programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Ever since Terry Windle and Julia Lenart got together 15 years ago, they have dreamed of having their own place in sunnier climes - and have decided Gran Canaria is the perfect place for them. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties for their £100,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: The Caribbean island of Nevis is very close to Steven and Murila Fifer's hearts. Murila was born there, and the couple have visited the place together many times over the years. They have now decided their dream holiday home should be on the island, so Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties within their £330,000 budget. Will they fall for a country villa or a beach-side home?.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Farzana Kausar from Stockport to find a home in Torrevieja on Spain's Costa Blanca that will be accessible for her daughter Aisha's wheelchair.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Gary and Susie, who want to start a new adventure in Florida's beautiful Sarasota Keys. For their budget of £220,000 they're after a place to escape the British winters, as close to the amazing beaches of the Gulf of Mexico as possible. Jonnie shows them how far their budget will stretch in this highly desirable corner of the US.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jerry and Christine Steele's love of South Africa began decades ago and they have decided to spend part of their retirement in a second home among the beaches and national parks of the Garden Route stretch of the south-eastern coast. For their budget of £60,000, Laura Hamilton shows them five great value properties.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Experts Kerr Drummond and Sara Damergi help Chipping Norton duo Leanne and Ricky look for a property in Scotland, with a budget of £220,000 to spend.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: David Bull and Kirsty Duffy help retired couple Tim and Sue find their forever home together in Somerset, searching both coastal and countryside properties on a budget of £390,000.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Wilkinsburg in Pennsylvania, home to Ms Jean's Southern Cuisine, which was opened by retired special-education teacher Jean Gould. During the chef's attempt to save the business from disaster, he discovers her soul-food restaurant resembles a dentist's waiting room and finds a lot of tension between Jean and her employees, who claim she is a Jekyll-and-Hyde character.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three of the most difficult cases he has taken on since the series began. First, he returns to Cafe Hon in Baltimore, Maryland, where owner Denise Whiting was trapped in a nasty battle with the community and had threatened the locals with lawsuits. Next, the chef goes back to Chiarella's in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. When he first visited owners Tommy and Dina DeFino, the business was struggling so badly that Tommy had completely lost his confidence and wife Dina had lost her patience. On his final stop, Gordon travels to Leone's in Montclair, New Jersey, where Rose Leone was depending on her lazy son Michael to run the restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits four restaurants he earlier tried to save, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or fallen by the wayside. First he visits the Spanish Pavillion in New Jersey, then heads to California to see the owners of Kingston Cafe, French-themed La Frite, and Capri.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: New series. The first of a new six-part run in which the nation's younger viewers maintain a close eye on a range of TV output. This series sees the existing army of junior sofa critics supplemented by newcomers Roma, Joel, Jack, Sadie, Declan, Amelinda and Yoanna, who join in to offer their honest, inimitable and ultimately hilarious take on recent shows to hit the small-screen. Items under scrutiny in this opening edition include coverage of the General Election, culinary queen Mary Berry and the classic movie Grease.(n)

programme.title: Ackley Bridge
programme.desc: New series. A six-part school drama series set in a Yorkshire mill town with a largely divided white and Asian population, as two formerly isolated comprehensive schools are merged into a brand new academy. In the first episode, English teacher Emma gets a shock when she finds out she's now working with her ex-boyfriend, while best friends and neighbours Missy and Nas attend school together for the first time.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Return of the documentary that follows the work of Bedfordshire Police around the clock as they investigate a number of major crimes. In the first edition, a man emerges from a hotel lift covered in blood and holding a fire extinguisher, before approaching the reception desk and shouting that he has killed someone. Cameras follow every twist and turn as detectives try to work out what really happened at the hotel close to Luton Airport, which has suddenly become a chaotic and bloody crime scene.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 79-year-old woman is airlifted to hospital after being involved in a road traffic collision, with consultants concerned that she may have life-threatening internal bleeding. Meanwhile, 80-year-old Mohammad has come to A&E after falling at home during a family Eid celebratory feast, and 56-year-old Russ is brought in after falling from a ladder while cutting back some trees at work.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Three young men from different walks of life are brought in to the A&E department of St George's Hospital in London, including 17-year-old Shea, who has serious stab wounds and is sent to a high dependency unit. Fellow 17-year-old Bob arrives after impaling his leg on a fence while taking a shortcut home from his boys' school, and 33-year-old James is brought in by ambulance after fainting at home.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Midwife Sarah and partner Stephen look forward to the arrival of their twins at Liverpool Women's Hospital. Cameras also follow young couple Holly and Nick, who surprised her mum Michelle by announcing their planned pregnancy. Meanwhile, Tasha and Jonny come in to have their second child after a traumatic birth with their first baby, Nevaeh.(n)

programme.title: Bodyshockers
programme.desc: Katie Piper meets Grimsby barman Lewis, who is calling time on a troublesome tattoo of Henry the Hoover above his private parts. The programme also features body modification jewellery designer Jenya, who has plans for stretching, and comic book artist Louis, who wants to brand his latest work onto his skin. Plus, a Christian fishmonger who regrets a Jesus inking meets a model planning to have a monster skeletal moth tattooed across her chest.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Elderly one-eyed South African porcupine Roxy is introduced to a new, younger male called Henning, in the hope that she will find companionship in her old age. Kifaru, the oldest eastern black rhino at Chester Zoo, meets younger female Malindi, with the expectation that they will produce offspring to increase the dwindling population, while the Caribbean flamingos are breeding again.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A Labrador is rushed to Fitzpatrick's unable to stand, and although Professor Noel Fitzpatrick tells the family that surgery is not an option, his team devises an alternative care plan. The vets also treat a bichon frise suffering chronic elbow pain, and a leonberger has a bone tumour removed from its leg after being diagnosed with cancer.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, Dan considers an Olympic football signed by the Team GB women and a 200-year-old picture with a royal connection. A monster sound system attracts the team in Brighton.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Charlie and Patrick Devine consider an offer for an extremely rare crystal-covered vodka bottle, and attempt to do a deal on a unique painting of boxer Muhammad Ali.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer head to Hampshire, where former naval officer Colin Nugent and wife Gillian are hoping to buy their first home after 23 years of marriage and 12 relocations with the military. Meanwhile, Army captain Ian Bellamy will be leaving the forces and is looking for a new house with girlfriend Diane Pittard.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help prospective buyers in the Home Counties, beginning with Sarah and Ian who sold their home in Buckinghamshire three years previously, but have made little progress finding their perfect property, despite more than 100 viewings and a budget of £1million. In Hertfordshire, twentysomethings Daniel and Louise have been forced to move back in with their parents after finding it difficult to compromise during their search.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: A couple want to retire to Suffolk so they can still be in easy reach of their families, so Kirsty Duffy and David Bull offer them the choices of both rural and seaside properties.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Chimneys B&B in Holbrook, Suffolk, where owner Carolyn Spilling hopes her upbeat personality will be a hit with the guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sex and the City fan Jose Stewart hosts the first dinner party in Lincolnshire for teacher Skip Schultz, tattooist Indy Nijjar, entrepreneur Sharon Wright and admin worker Jessica Carroll, but struggles to concentrate on her Spanish-themed menu, opting instead to spend her time on Twitter. A game of truth or dare then brings out some interesting revelations, as well as an unlikely romantic encounter.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: History teacher Skip Schultz hosts the second party in Lincolnshire, planning an evening to celebrate his American roots. While the guests are impressed with the starter, the main course proves a confusing flop, and Skip has to rely on his entertainment to save the day.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Entrepreneur Sharon Wright hosts Lincolnshire's third party, hoping to impress with dishes of seared scallops, crispy-top pork belly, and chocolate praline tart, which she has repeatedly practised in preparation for the evening. The businesswoman has a strict schedule and has considered her guests' every need, even hiring a gardener to ensure the yard is in full bloom.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Tattoo artist Indy Nijjar hosts a summer-themed dinner party in Lincolnshire, instructing his guests to bring swimwear with them. In a last-ditch bid to score high marks, he decides to serve his dessert in a unique place, but will have to wait and see whether it is enough to win the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Admin worker Jessica Carroll hosts the final party in Lincolnshire. Despite demonstrating a distinct lack of culinary knowledge over the course of the week, including asking teacher Skip Schultz if his pumpkin pie contained pumpkin, she hopes her Chinese meal and unusual pet will impress the guests.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: Location, Location, Location

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: In America, the waters of Lake Erie turn pea green, while a man in New Zealand finds eels swimming in his street after a sudden and violent downpour. A photographer captures rare images of a moustache cloud, New York City grinds to a halt as onlookers witness the beautiful sunset known as `Manhattanhenge', and in Hawaii, volcanic lava creates tornados of steam on the ocean surface. A terrifying mudslide roars through a sleepy Austrian village, while wind and rain carve ancient rocks into giant mushroom-like shapes in Egypt.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: The officers chase a debt of almost £2,000 in unpaid parking fines, and later encounter the extraordinary case of a debt of £80,000 owed by a hotel owner to his ex-girlfriend. However, as they begin to search the property, they call upon police back-up as the agents fear the debtor may have access to firearms. Elsewhere, two officers head to a car garage in Manchester where the owner owes £2,000 after losing a court case over a faulty vehicle.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In south London, Del and Dael Anglin receive a hostile reception from the brother of a debtor who has alreasy defaulted on a promise to pay £2,000 she owes to a storage company. In Worcestershire, Gareth and Craig try to recover £45,000 from a young online entrepreneur, who claims no responsibility for the debt he owes to his courier. Their target cooks up a flimsy lie in an effort to absolve himself, but dishonesty proves to be the least of the agents' worries when they discover a stash of guns at the back of the garage. In east London, an Indian restaurant owner begins to take his financial responsibilities seriously when Del and Dael start removing cookers and freezers from his premises, and a pair of pensioners in Oxfordshire hope the High Court will provide them a lifeline as they try to pay off a £4,000 bill to a solicitors' firm after a failed compensation claim.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: The agents have an explosive run-in with a debtor as they try to retrieve £1,800 owed by a car dealership, and in Derbyshire, two officers try to collect more than £1,500 in unpaid parking fines. Elsewhere, Max and Paul are in London as they attempt to recover £2,000 owed by a property company, but an employee refuses to let them enter.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: Documentary telling the stories of people struggling to live on state welfare, something made all the more difficult by their individual battles with the bulge. Blossom lives in Brighton and has various health problems. Now she has discovered she many have cervical cancer and needs exploratory surgery - but at 25 stone, doctors have told her she is too fat to go under general anaesthetic. In Bexhill, Gina and Gary claim more than £10,000 a year in benefits. Gina has always been big but now she worries she has symptoms of diabetes. Archie near Manchester tips the scales at 26 stone and hasn't had a full-time job for six years. However, for four weeks of the year he earns money dressing up as Father Christmas.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: People facing benefit problems in Wales, including a Tredegar man who bemoans the lack of opportunities in the Valleys and a Newport woman who wants a new flat and is thinking about having a baby - but needs a loan before any of that can happen. Plus, a man who had a successful business but lost everything. After a spell of homelessness, he now has a place to call home.(n)

programme.title: Wentworth Prison
programme.desc: Franky asks Jianna's son to help prove her innocence, and Liz's decision to testify against Sonia has serious repercussions in court. Drama, starring Nicola da Silva.(n)

programme.title: The Butcher Surgeon: Why Wasn't He Stopped
programme.desc: Documentary profiling former breast surgeon Ian Paterson, who was recently convicted of intentionally wounding patients by performing needless operations for more than a decade. Paterson was found guilty on 17 counts, and this programme examines how was he able to continue for so long, asking whether his employers might have ignored or failed to act on a series of warnings stretching back to 2003. Some of Paterson's victims are also interviewed, along with health service whistleblowers.(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: Produced by Tom Hanks, written by Aaron Sorkin, and directed by Mike Nichols, this adaptation of George Crile III's incendiary bestseller tells the remarkable story of the Texas congressman whose efforts to prevent the Red Army from overtaking Afghanistan eventually led to the collapse of the Soviet Union while simultaneously fueling the rise of radical Islam. In the early 1980s, a hastily assembled army of Afghan "freedom fighters" achieved the remarkable feat of fending off Soviet invaders despite the fact that the odds were overwhelmingly stacked against them. At the time, Texas congressman Charlie Wilson (Hanks) was a key member of the hugely powerful House Appropriations Committee. Illuminated to the specifics of this remarkable war by a high-profile Houston socialite, Wilson spearheaded an effort to provide hundreds of millions of dollars in weapons and training to the Mujahideen with more than a little help from brilliant but prickly CIA operative Gust Avrokotos(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: Three men relive their carefree college years by killing off as many brain cells as possible in this over-the-top comedy. Mitch (Luke Wilson) returns home from a less-than-pleasant business trip one evening to discover his wife, Heidi (Juliette Lewis), involved in a ménage à trois with two blindfolded strangers. Feeling less than welcome at home after this, Mitch rents a house near the campus of a nearby college; two of Mitch's old college buddies, Beanie (Vince Vaughn) and Frank (Will Ferrell), stop by to cheer him up. They soon become regular guests at Mitch's place, despite the fact that Frank only recently wed Marissa (Perrey Reeves), while Beanie and his wife, Lara (Leah Remini), are busy with two kids. Beanie decides to throw a housewarming party for Mitch, and since Beanie sells audio equipment for a living, he's able to trick out the big bash with a massive PA system and an appearance by Snoop Dogg. Mitch soon finds he's the not-entirely-willing proprietor of the school's leading party spot, which raises the ire of Pritchard (Jeremy Piven), a dean at the college who was the target of Mitch, Frank, and Beanie's abuse when they were all students. Pritchard arranges to have Mitch's neighborhood zoned into a student housing district, but Beanie and Frank respond by forming a fraternity and making Mitch's home their headquarters. Mitch, however, is not enthusiastic about the idea, especially as he's trying to impress Nicole (Ellen Pompeo), a beautiful divorcee who is less than enchanted with Frank and Beanie's "party hearty" lifestyle. Old School director Todd Phillips knows more than a bit about the seamy side of fraternity life as director of the infamous unreleased documentary Frat House(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: With the help of his best friend John, a sentient teddy bear named Ted fights to be legally recognized as a human so he can have a child with his new wife Tami-Lynn(n)

programme.title: Just Cause
programme.desc: A Harvard law professor attempts to prove the innocence of a man wrongly sentenced to Florida's death row in this legal thriller. The imprisoned Bobby Earl Ferguson (Blair Underwood) chooses to write to Paul Armstrong (Sean Connery) because of the respected academic's public stance against the death penalty. Not having practiced law in years, Armstrong is reluctant to take the case but is ultimately convinced by Ferguson's eloquence. The professor journeys south to the Florida Everglades to investigate, discovering evidence that Ferguson was framed by a false confession obtained by brutal local police officer Tanny Brown (Laurence Fishburne)(n)

programme.title: Jurassic World
programme.desc: Twenty-two years after Jurassic Park opened on Isla Nubar, a dinosaur-themed resort attracts thousands of visitors each year, just as John Hammond envisioned. However, following a bad sag in turnout a new effort is undertaken to revitalise Jurassic World, but once again mankind's attempts to interfere with nature bring ominous results(n)

programme.title: Joy
programme.desc: The tumultuous life of entrepreneur Joy Mangano, a divorced mother of two who risked her life's savings to produce and market her invention of the Miracle Mop. The success of that invention sparked her television-shopping business empire(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A 70-year-old widower comes out of retirement to take an internship at a trendy fashion magazine(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: Best friends Liv and Emma discover their dream weddings have been booked at the same venue on the same date and an epic catfight ensues(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: After an exploratory mission goes awry, lone astronaut Mark Watney (Matt Damon) is left for dead on the hostile surface of Mars and must use his scientific ingenuity to homestead an enclosed habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, the astronauts he left behind realize the severity of his plight and join forces with an international coalition of scientists to launch a rescue mission in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Midnight Cowboy
programme.desc: Rare indeed for a film's two leads to be both nominated for the Best Actor Oscar, but that's what happened to Dustin Hoffman and Jon Voight for their roles as the sickly yet streetwise New York hustler Rico and would-be gigolo Joe Buck, a rube from Texas in John Schlesinger's landmark(n)

programme.title: Sgt. Bilko
programme.desc: A conniving army sergeant pulls numerous cons while feuding with one of his former victims who attempts to get him kicked out of the service(n)

programme.title: The Cotton Club
programme.desc: Richard Gere and Bob Hoskins star in Francis Ford Coppola's panorama of love, crime and entertainment in this stylish gangster film, centred on the legendary Harlem Nightclub. (1984)(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: A man gets a last-chance job coaching a small-town Indiana high-school basketball team and faces the dual challenge of bringing this underdog team to the 1951 state championship and redeeming himself from a mysterious past(n)

programme.title: The 33
programme.desc: A film based on the true story of the mission to rescue 33 miners who were trapped in a underground mine for 69 days(n)

programme.title: Capote
programme.desc: An exemplary biopic that focuses on the six years Capote spent working on his 1966 masterpiece "In Cold Blood"(n)

programme.title: Shoot 'Em Up
programme.desc: A stranger steps in to save a pregnant woman from hitman Hertz. He delivers her baby and takes off, pursued by the killer and his henchmen(n)

programme.title: The Enforcer
programme.desc: Maverick cop Dirty Harry Callahan is unimpressed with his new partner Kate Moore. But the pair must try to put their differences aside in order to tackle the People's Revolutionary Strike Force, an underground terrorist group who have stolen a truckload of weapons from an arms storehouse and are threatening to blow the city to smithereens unless their demands are met(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: The lives of guards on Death Row are affected by one of their charges: a black man accused of child murder and rape, yet who has a mysterious gift(n)

programme.title: Gran Torino
programme.desc: Disgruntled Korean War vet Walt Kowalski sets out to reform his neighbour, a young Hmong teenager, who tried to steal Kowalski's prized possession: his 1972 Gran Torino(n)

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: Academy Award-winning Exorcist director William Friedkin scuttles deep into the darkest recesses of the traumatized human psyche with this tale of a lonely bartender haunted by the long-ago disappearance of her young son, and the paranoia that emerges when she enters into a tentative relationship with a deeply disturbed drifter. Adapted from the off-Broadway play by Tracy Letts, Bug centers on Agnes (Ashley Judd), who tends bar alongside pal R.C. (Lynn Collins), and has recently moved into a shoddy roadside motel in hopes of avoiding her menacing and recently paroled ex-husband, Jerry (Harry Connick Jr.). Upon making the acquaintance of subdued former soldier Peter (Michael Shannon, repeating his stage role), a veteran of the first Gulf War, Agnes finally senses that things are looking up. Quietly charming despite his melancholy aura, Peter soon reveals to Agnes that he contracted a "bug" while serving in the Middle East, and that it may have been deliberately administered as part of a secret military medical experiment. Convinced that the microscopic insects are quickly multiplying just under the surface of his skin and that they have now infected Agnes as well, Peter soon descends into a psychotic rage as he resorts to increasingly desperate measures to purge himself of the offending subdermal arthropods(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Col. Terry Childers is a 30-year Marine veteran: a decorated officer with combat experience in Vietnam, Beirut and Desert Storm - a patriot, a hero. But now, the country he served so well has put him on trial for a rescue mission that went terribly wrong. For his attorney, he has chosen Marine Col. Hays Hodges, a comrade-in-arms who owes his life to Childers. Hodges is not the best lawyer in the service, but Childers trusts him as a brother Marine who knows what it's like to risk death under fire. Bound by duty and friendship, Hodges reluctantly takes the case, even as he begins to doubt the man who saved his life in Vietnam three decades ago(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Longmire
programme.desc: Walt investigates the murder of a teenager who was one of four boys acquitted of raping a Cheyenne girl who had learning disabilities. When another of them is killed, all signs point to the crime being an act of revenge by the victim's brother. Meanwhile, the arrival of a detective from Denver forces Walt to finally confront the reality of his wife's death. Guest starring Charles S Dutton.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: The number of an already dying man comes up, and Reese leaves the team behind in the aftermath of the war with the crime organisation. Meanwhile, flashbacks to Finch's adolescence provide an insight into his creation of The Machine. Jim Caviezel and Michael Emerson star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A wealthy businessman is killed at a charity event and suspicion falls on his wife, whose blood matches a sample found at the crime scene. However, it later transpires that she has a twin sister - and the victim had a double of his own. Crime drama, starring David Caruso, Adam Rodriguez and Khandi Alexander.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: A Bird in the Hand
programme.desc: A compulsive gambler with a mountain of debts comes up with a plan to make some easy money. He plants a bomb under his wealthy uncle's car in the hope of inheriting a large legacy - but a hit-and-run driver jeopardises the entire scheme and Columbo is soon sniffing around for clues. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Tyne Daly, Greg Evigan and Don S Davis.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Candidate for Crime
programme.desc: An ambitious senatorial candidate murders his campaign manager for threatening to expose his secret affair. To avoid suspicion, the politician makes the killing look as if he was the intended target of an assassination attempt that went wrong - but ends up having to pit his wits against the slovenly sleuth. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Jackie Cooper, Ken Swofford and Tisha Sterling.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: The shabby sleuth investigates the complex case of a murdered Hollywood gossip writer. He uses his unique talents to interrogate a smooth-talking funeral director, who was once romantically involved with the victim and one of the last people to see her alive. Detective drama, with Peter Falk. Patrick McGoohan co-stars and directs.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates the parades and parties at Mardi Gras after a petty officer is found murdered. Money and possessions were still on the deceased's body, so Pride rules out robbery as a motive and security footage suggests the victim had already been stabbed before he even made it to the event. More worryingly, further investigations lead to a tip-off about an upcoming `heist' at the festivities. Stacy Keach guest stars, with Scott Bakula.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After navy recruiter Maggie Barringer is targeted in a fatal hit-and-run incident, Chris and Meredith learn she was foster mother to two teenage brothers. Advised the youngsters will be separated, Pride and Dr Wade plead for compassion, but agency worker Sumner St Croix is strangely adamant. While the duo contemplate whether Maggie's murder was tied to her career or to her role as a foster mother, Chris becomes increasingly concerned about the welfare of his brother Cade.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Director Vance charges DiNozzo with a special assignment to go to France, locate Admiral Kendall's wayward daughter Amanda and bring her home. Arriving in Marseille, Tony immediately heads to the local NCIS office, only to find five dead agents. After eventually tracking down Amanda, the pair embark on a rollercoaster ride to the relative safety of the nearest NCIS office in Spain. Michael Weatherly stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: A hated businesswoman is found dead under an ice sculpture with her heart completely frozen. The investigators identify liquid nitrogen as the cause and discover a number of suspects among her employees and associates. Meanwhile, a woman's body falls onto the roof of a school bus - and the ensuing investigation leads Mac and Danny to a dangerous new designer drug.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: A family-court judge is beaten to death in his apartment, but there is no sign of forced entry, and a college student is fatally shot in the street - with the same weapon used on the first victim. Flack fears Danny Messer is looking for revenge against Ollie Barnes, the man responsible for the robbery in which a bystander died. With Carmine Giovinazzo and Eddie Cahill.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A school headmistress is caught on camera sexually assaulting a teenage boy, but her behaviour later proves to have been caused by an operable brain tumour, prompting Novak and the team to allow a plea bargain. Unfortunately, the case turns out to have unforeseen complications. Starring Christopher Meloni, Mariska Hargitay and Diane Neal.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A woman is arrested after the attempted kidnapping a six-year-old girl, and tells officers the child is her daughter. DNA evidence appears to support her claim, and the ensuing investigation uncovers a fertility doctor's unethical practices, prompting a custody battle between the child's biological parent and the woman who gave birth to her. Christopher Meloni stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler investigate the disappearance of a Chinese woman and her daughter, and uncover a conspiracy involving women smuggled into the country by gangsters running a prostitution ring. Crime drama, starring Christopher Meloni, Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the rape of a teenage TV personality whose raunchy antics on and off camera had made her unpopular within the community. As events unfold, they are shocked to discover her suspected attacker may have been acting on the suggestion of a controversial DJ who had been baiting the star over the airwaves.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives are taunted by a serial killer who leaves clues about his next targets scattered around the city. Suspecting the perpetrator is emulating the crimes of a murderer active in the 1970s, they visit the one surviving victim of the original, a woman who was recently quizzed about the case by a reporter.(n)

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: The author investigates when a senior lawyer who specialised in divorces is killed with an icepick. Meanwhile, his ex-wife, Meredith, moves into the loft to take care of Alexis while she recovers from illness. American crime drama, starring Nathan Fillion, Molly Quinn and Darby Stanchfield.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.sub-title: Swept Away - A Very Special Episode.
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the suspicious death of a reality TV contestant. They discover the show's producers had been provoking bad feeling toward the dead man among his fellow participants, while a cameraman reveals that his last moments were captured on film. However, the incriminating tape cannot be found. Jerry Orbach and Steven Hill star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green have difficulty pinning the death of a strangled woman on their prime suspect, drug dealer Francis `Taz' Partell. However, while questioning one of his former associates, they discover new evidence indicating he was responsible for another murder in the Bronx.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Flack and Stella interrogate a congressman suspected of involvement in the murder of a drag queen. Danny and Mac look into the case of an extreme sports executive found dead in a gritter used to de-ice streets, and Lindsay heads for Montana to testify against a man who killed four of her friends. Drama, starring Anna Belknap and Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen, Kensi and the team hunt for an electromagnetic pulse device that was stolen from a college research facility, and could destroy Los Angeles if activated, killing millions of people. Elsewhere, Sam is on the lookout for a Christmas present for his daughter. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell, LL Cool J and Daniela Ruah.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: The author is pushed to his limits and must work alongside the FBI when Alexis and the daughter of a wealthy businessman are kidnapped. The hostages, meanwhile, are stunned to learn they are being held in Paris. American crime drama, starring Nathan Fillion.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: Control, Hersh and their operatives hold Finch, Shaw and Claypool captive, demanding to know the location of Finch's Machine. However, the trio receive support from an unexpected quarter. Meanwhile, Reese contemplates the nature of his work. Jim Caviezel and Michael Emerson star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A man is found stabbed to death in an alleyway, and the detectives discover he shined shoes for a living. They begin by looking for his most recent customers, and learn the victim was a Vietnam war veteran, shedding light on possible motives and suspects.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A wealthy widow and her daughter are implicated in the death of a hitman out on parole - and it's up to the squad to find out whether the pair hired the victim to kill a rich relative. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Sam Waterston.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: A man in a fancy-dress knight's costume is found stabbed with a lance in Central Park, and evidence suggests the victim had been jousting before his death. Meanwhile, another case takes a strange turn when a supposed corpse stolen from the team's custody is found in a river - alive. Gary Sinise and Melina Kanakaredes star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A vehicle transporting Jada Khaled to her criminal tribunal is ambushed, prompting the team to trace the culprit in an attempt to save her and the case. Meanwhile, concerns grow for Sam as it is the first time he has seen the former governor's sister since returning from Sudan. Crime drama, starring LL Cool J and Ella Thomas.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates when a diplomatic service van is hijacked during the transportation of an unknown package from the State Department. As Callen and Sam celebrate their fifth anniversary as partners, the pair undertake their trickiest undercover operation to date. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs travels to his home town after hearing news of his father's death, while the team investigates whether a fire on a US Navy ship was accidental or planned. The vessel served as prison to several members of the Brotherhood of Doubt terrorist group, whom Gibbs was responsible for catching. After the blaze, two of those members are missing. Tony argues that Gibbs would want to know, but Vance does not want him disturbed at this difficult time. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A teenager is found beaten and apparently raped on a building site. Her account of the ordeal leads to a media frenzy in which several army cadets are named as suspects and Stabler's job is put in jeopardy. However, a TV channel later gains possession of video tape from the evening of her attack, and it becomes clear she has not been entirely honest.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler arrest a psychiatrist who has taken the law into his own hands and avenged his young son's death at the hands of another child. programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: Academy Award-winning Exorcist director William Friedkin scuttles deep into the darkest recesses of the traumatized human psyche with this tale of a lonely bartender haunted by the long-ago disappearance of her young son, and the paranoia that emerges when she enters into a tentative relationship with a deeply disturbed drifter. Adapted from the off-Broadway play by Tracy Letts, Bug centers on Agnes (Ashley Judd), who tends bar alongside pal R.C. (Lynn Collins), and has recently moved into a shoddy roadside motel in hopes of avoiding her menacing and recently paroled ex-husband, Jerry (Harry Connick Jr.). Upon making the acquaintance of subdued former soldier Peter (Michael Shannon, repeating his stage role), a veteran of the first Gulf War, Agnes finally senses that things are looking up. Quietly charming despite his melancholy aura, Peter soon reveals to Agnes that he contracted a "bug" while serving in the Middle East, and that it may have been deliberately administered as part of a secret military medical experiment. Convinced that the microscopic insects are quickly multiplying just under the surface of his skin and that they have now infected Agnes as well, Peter soon descends into a psychotic rage as he resorts to increasingly desperate measures to purge himself of the offending subdermal arthropods(n)

programme.title: Maximum Overdrive
programme.desc: The Rhea-M comet starts revolving round earth and provokes all machinery to become their own masters and revolt against mankind. The Rhea-M comet starts revolving round earth and provokes all machinery to become their own masters and revolt against mankind. A group of people find shelter in a relay station and are surrounded by a horde of raging trucks. After a tremendous fight. Bill, Bubba, Brett and some others manage to reach the coast and set sail to an island void of technology(n)

programme.title: The Darkness

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: San Francisco cop Harry Callahan is a man who'd rather use his.44 magnum than talk his way out of a sticky situation. His propensity for violence gets him branded a maverick and thrown off the force until a crazed serial killer begins terrorizing the town(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Hulk
programme.desc: Mild-mannered scientist Bruce Banner has been traveling the globe in search of the antidote that will allow him to break free from his primal alter ego, but both the warmongers who long to exploit him for their own gain and a horrific creature known as The Abomination are determined to stop him from achieving his noble goal in Transporter 2 director Louis Leterrier's take on the classic Marvel Comics superhero tale. For years, Bruce (Edward Norton) has been living in the shadows, pursued by the military and haunted by the rage within. But traveling the world in secrecy isn't easy, and as hard as he tries Bruce can't get Betty Ross (Liv Tyler) off his mind. The daughter of Bruce's nemesis Gen. Thaddeus "Thunderbolt" Ross (William Hurt), Betty represents everything that is beautiful in the world to a man who lives his life on the run. Eventually, Bruce returns to civilization and faces the wrath of The Abomination. While the Hulk may be a formidable force of nature, The Abomination is decidedly more powerful, and determined to destroy Bruce Banner. Created when KGB agent Emil Blonsky (Tim Roth) exposed himself to a higher dose of the same radiation that transformed Bruce into The Hulk, The Abomination is unable to change back into human form and holds Bruce accountable for his frightful condition. With time fast running out for both Bruce and The Hulk, New York City is about to become the ultimate urban battle zone as two of the most powerful creatures ever to walk the earth clash in a massive, no-holds-barred fight to the finish(n)

programme.desc: Cherokee Bigfoot. The AIMS team take special precautions when they travel to Ashe County, N.C., on a mission to find a creature called "The Cherokee Devil," which they believe possesses mind-control abilities(n)

programme.title: Mountain Monsters: Bigfoot Files
programme.desc: Cherokee Bigfoot Returns. A rift develops between team members, some of whom consider quitting AIMS, when they visit Ashe County, N.C., in search of a savage Bigfoot known as the Cherokee Devil(n)

programme.title: Mountain Monsters: Bigfoot Files
programme.desc: Tree-tossing Bigfoot. The investigators travel to Clay County, W.Va., looking for the "yahoo" who threw trees at them and destroyed their trap last fall(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics London
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore properties about to be auctioned, including a mid-terrace house near Birmingham, a flat in Maida Hill, west London, and a plot of land in Fife's historic Dunfermline. Later they meet the new owners and discuss their plans for the purchases, before checking back on their progress.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: A pair of sisters and two students select antiques to take to auction in Newark, Nottinghamshire, helped by experts Richard Madley and Catherine Southon. Tim Wonnacott presents.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Greg and Jenni Wallen spend a trial week living in Auckland, New Zealand, with Greg keen to return to the country he fell in love with while backpacking.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore's recycling mission takes her to Altrincham, Greater Manchester, where wallpaper designer Daniel Heath must use all his creativity to transform a set of rusty railings.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: A look at some of the best finds by experts Thomas Plant, Adam Partridge, James Lewis, Mark Stacey and others during the programme's visits to Edinburgh, Wallasey, Southwell and Dunster Castle. Items featured include a collection of war medals and a unique funeral invitation. Plus, Paul Martin takes a tour of the Library of Birmingham and discovers what it has brought to the city.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin travels to Cornwall to help a woman with a passion for horses search for a rural respite with a budget of £465,000. Away from the hunt, he meets a boat builder.(n)

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine presents a selection of viewers' comments on BBC shows, a chance to see memorable clips, and an insight into what goes on behind the scenes of new programmes.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Radio 2 DJ Johnnie Walker and his wife Tiggy discuss caring for a partner battling cancer. Plus, an introduction to the soldiers preparing for this year's Trooping the Colour.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: New series. Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin help the Rielly family lower their food bills, showing them simple and effective ways to save money on their weekly food shop. The pair have a challenge on their hands as each member of the busy family have very different eating habits, meaning mum Stacy cooks 3 different dinners every night, including meals for her son Harry, who has Type 1 diabetes.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The rural current affairs series visits Northern Ireland, where Joe Crowley heads into the woods near Belfast to help members of the RSPB tag swifts. He also tours a farm where physalis, mustard flowers and Asian radishes are found growing alongside the usual fare of potatoes, carrots and cauliflowers. Ellie Harrison takes in sites associated with St Patrick on Church Island, and Adam Henson finds out why herdwick sheep are being used to graze on ground where some of the UK's rarest plants are found.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a second show from New Lanark on the banks of the Clyde, where items brought in to be valued include diamonds that were found after being hidden inside an upholstered chair, a claret jug that was rescued from a pawn shop, and a banner for Britain's oldest subscription library, founded in 1741.(n)

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: New series. The popular period drama based on the novels of Winston Graham returns. The year is 1794, and Ross Poldark throws himself into the business of repairing Nampara, and rebuilding his relationship with Demelza. However, Elizabeth's pregnancy continues to cast a shadow over the pair's marriage. Young Geoffrey Charles is placed in the care of a new governess, and he and Poldark bond over their shared hatred of George. Meanwhile, Demelza visits her dying father at the behest of her brothers, who have taken up Methodism, and Elizabeth places both her own life and that of her unborn child in danger when she tries to hide the fact that she has gone into labour early. Starring Aidan Turner, Eleanor Tomlinson and Heida Reed.(n)

programme.title: Captain America: The Winter Soldier
programme.desc: The superhuman soldier becomes an operative for secret intelligence agency SHIELD, but grows suspicious of their motives. Following a battle with a mysterious cyborg assassin, he and fellow Avenger Black Widow become fugitives, and try to bring down a sinister conspiracy. Comic-book thriller sequel, starring Chris Evans, Scarlett Johansson, Samuel L Jackson and Robert Redford.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: New series. Rav Wilding returns with more appeals for information about crimes, with roving reporter Michelle Ackerley going behind the scenes with police services around the UK.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore properties about to be auctioned in Forest Hill, London, Nelson in Lancashire, and Crewe in Cheshire.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Hospital Bed
programme.desc: A two-year-old boy struggling to breathe is brought into Newcastle's Royal Victoria Infirmary, while doctors are worried a 73-year-old woman might have had a stroke.(n)

programme.title: The Housing Enforcers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright visits what could easily be Britain's filthiest home, and a homeless father and his sons receive the help they need.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Danny Sebastian and David Harper help the red and blue teams find bargains in the antiques shops of Dorking in Surrey, while presenter Anita Manning visits the local museum.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ruhma and Heston get the silent treatment, but Sid has a bit too much to say during his session with Megan. Mrs Tembe has to deal with a theft at the church.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single `impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps a couple to search for a property in the Hampshire countryside on a £650,000 budget, and away from the hunt, he visits a farm reviving English-grown peppermint.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Bryn Williams puts three home cooks through a series of culinary challenges, teaching them how to fillet and cook a lemon sole. Sheree Murphy hosts.(n)

programme.title: Street Auction
programme.desc: Paul Martin helps members of communities raise funds for a deserving neighbour, beginning with a 91-year-old poppy seller in Thatcham, Berkshire. With Irina Aggrey.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones, Matt Baker and a team of roving reporters present topical stories from around the UK.(n)

programme.title: Big Love
programme.desc: The story of James and Phil Lusted from north Wales, who have a rare form of dwarfism and are 3ft 7 and 3ft respectively. The film reveals how they managed to find love with women of average height, with both of them engaged to be married. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Lauren faces a challenging day as she prepares to assist Max with an important presentation, while a devious Abi plans trouble between her sister and Steven. Carmel and Kim encourage Denise to apply for a job at the town hall, while Kush offers Jack some advice. Keegan starts to spread a rumour about Louise, and despite her denial, the gossips are soon out in force.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Radio 4 Today programme presenter Nick Robinson reports on the outcome of last Thursday's general election and what the result means for the nation.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.sub-title: Planet Earth II: A World of Wonder.
programme.desc: A compilation of some of the most spectacular footage from the series, capturing wildlife from around the world on film using the latest camera technology, and revealing how they adapt to overcome the challenges posed by living in jungles, mountains, deserts, islands, grasslands and cities.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Election News for You.
programme.desc: Extended edition. Comedian Jo Brand assumes the mantle as host, inviting former Labour MP Alan Johnson and comedian Ross Noble to join regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to reflect on the general election campaign.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham chats to WBA, IBF and IBO heavyweight boxing champion Anthony Joshua, who recently secured his status thanks to his 11th round knockdown of Ukrainian opponent Wladimir Klitschko. Oscar-winning actress Rachel Weisz discusses her new film My Cousin Rachel, while Shawn Mendes performs There's Nothing Holdin' Me Back, and actor Martin Freeman and comedian Greg Davies are also on the sofa.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Joe Swift, Carol Klein and Adam Frost take an exclusive look at the new RHS Chatsworth Flower Show, meeting designer Jo Thompson as she prepares her show garden with a difference. In the Floral Pavilion, Carol finds pioneering plants that have shaped the gardens of today, while garden designer Arit Anderson looks to the future - meeting the team behind a garden built for the changing climate.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter and George Anderson don their waders to clear the blanketweed from the pond, and Jim McColl also wages war on his weeds - using a flamethrower. George joins Brian Cunningham to create a sky effect alpine wall using blue and white plants, and Carole visits a garden in a quarry at Blebo Craigs near Strathkinness, Fife.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Ellie Harrison report from Essex, visiting a restored oyster boat, a nature reserve for dragonflies, and a colony of common seals, and meeting people who build racing rowing boats. Steve Brown learns to fire a medieval longbow, Tom Heap reports on environmental damage caused by spoil heaps, and Adam Henson and Charlotte Smith meet a contender for Countryfile's Young Farmer Award.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: The Big Questions
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell presents a moral and religious discussion from Harris Academy, Peckham, on the subject of whether interfering with genes is ethical.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Venezuela v England (Kick-off 11.00am). Mark Chapman presents coverage of the final, held at Suwon World Cup Stadium in South Korea, as England look to win their first World Cup at any level of football since 1966. With analysis from Danny Mills and Trevor Sinclair, and commentary by Guy Mowbray.(n)

programme.title: Live Triathlon
programme.desc: Ore Oduba presents coverage of the men's and women's elite races in the fourth round of the ITU World Series from Leeds. Much of the focus, as always, will be on Alistair and Jonny Brownlee in the men's race, with Jonny looking to recover from his bike crash last time out in Yokohama, and Alistair making his first World Series appearance of the season. The women's race also features British contenders, in former world champion Non Stanford and Olympic medallist Vicky Holland.(n)

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.desc: Engineer Linda Miller battles to rebuild a Victorian tunnel under the Royal Docks in the East End as part of the Crossrail train line linking east and west London. Meanwhile, the Berminghams attempt to follow in the footsteps of 19th-century father-and-son team Marc and Isambard Kingdom Brunel as they construct a new tunnel beneath the Thames.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Evan Davis presents the show as more entrepreneurs try to impress the panel. Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sarah Willingham and Nick Jenkins cast their eyes over an innovative tool and a portable water-saving device. However, a restaurateur struggles to get across the details of his business plan.(n)

programme.title: The Life Swap Adventure
programme.desc: A hunter from the Amazon rainforest trades places with a civil servant in London, as the adventure travelogue continues. Guyanese Lionel, who has lived as part of the self-sustaining Machousi tribe, learns that a life of comfort in the British capital comes at a cost that many are unable to afford, and plans to communicate this to his city-obsessed children back home. Meanwhile, civil servant John discovers the essential value of community as he visits Lionel's village Surama, where the arrival of money and capitalism threaten to end a way of life that has survived for centuries.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Big Continental Road Trip
programme.desc: The Bake Off judge concludes his trip in France, as he tries to find out what makes the country tick when it comes to cars. Paul's six-day road trip begins in Paris, where he is joined for the day by the host of French Top Gear, Philippe Lellouche. In a classic Citroen DS, they set off through the rain and experience the joys of Parisian traffic jams and the mayhem which is the roundabout around the Arc de Triomphe. The final day sees Paul travel to Magny-Cours racing circuit to meet two Formula 1 legends and Jean Pierre Jabouille, the man who drove the first F1 turbo car. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: New series. Dara O Briain returns with a timely new run of the topical comedy show, with Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, James Acaster, Milton Jones and Tez Ilyas joining regular panellist Hugh Dennis to take a comic look at what's been happening in the news through stand-up and improvised games.(n)

programme.title: White Gold
programme.desc: When Vincent receives a visit from a tax inspector, pursuing him for unpaid tax, he decides that now would be a good time to get out of the showroom and spend some more time with his family. They take a trip to Southend, but it does not go exactly as they planned. Meanwhile, Fitzpatrick and Lavender clash over the ethics of Page 3 when a competition in The Sun newspaper arises, and Vincent's side-business, pirating copies on E.T on VHS in the backroom of the showroom, continues to roll out in his absence.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights
programme.desc: India v South Africa. Action from the Group B encounter at the Oval, as the one-day competition continued.(n)

programme.title: Sailing
programme.desc: Shirley Robertson presents action from the opening day of the challenger play-off finals in Bermuda, as the teams competed for the right to face reigning champions Oracle Team USA.(n)

programme.title: Kings of Curry
programme.desc: Two brothers who are both chefs fall out, and decide to split their family recipe book in two, opening competing restaurants on the same street. After 20 years of rivalry, the daughter of one of the pair is determined to reconcile her father and uncle so they can both attend her wedding. Comedy, starring Amara Karan and Harish Patel. In English and Hindi.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Ellie Harrison report from Essex, visiting a restored oyster boat, a nature reserve for dragonflies, and a colony of common seals, and meeting people who build racing rowing boats. Steve Brown learns to fire a medieval longbow, Tom Heap reports on environmental damage caused by spoil heaps, and Adam Henson and Charlotte Smith meet a contender for Countryfile's Young Farmer Award.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Dominic and Sacha clash professionally, but there's more to it than meets the eye as an out of control Dominic reaches a crisis point. Meanwhile, with Jac and Jasmine at odds, Fran makes it her business to reunite them with unsettling consequences. And a new arrival on Darwin gets more than they bargained for, especially after accepting Jason's help.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Emergency Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: British emergency workers at the other side of the world. A cop deals with trouble at an Australian rules football game and a flying doctor is called out to a freak accident in the Bush.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Julia Somerville, Angela Rippon and Gloria Hunniford explore the implications of the recent vegetable shortage, and the effect it continues to have today. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Galton Blackiston, Frances Atkins, Rupert Rowley and Theo Randall pair up with their chosen home cook partners and go head to head in the ultimate pro-am cooking competition.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from an 18th-century cotton mill on the banks of the River Clyde. Among the items brought in to be valued are a pearl necklace bought cheaply at a car boot sale, a rare cuddly toy found in a skip, and a valuable clock. One guest brings in a painting that is a reminder of an uncomfortable family secret.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from correspondents around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: The Golden Gala Pietro Mennea. Gabby Logan presents action from the fourth Diamond League event of the season, which was held at the Stadio Olimpico in Rome.(n)

programme.title: Sailing
programme.desc: Shirley Robertson presents action from the second day of the challenger play-off finals in Bermuda, as the teams competed for the right to face reigning champions Oracle Team USA.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: A confident new arrival attracts attention, Michael must keep his family in the dark about a foolhardy move and investigators seek the likely mole in the Garda station.(n)

programme.title: Elephant Diaries
programme.desc: Jonathan Scott observes two new arrivals from the nursery to see how they cope in the wild, while Michaela Strachan waits for the delivery of an orphan baby elephant at Nairobi airport. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy narrates a documentary examining the lives of animals and people pitting themselves against the world's wildest ocean, unveiling the natural forces that underpin life in the Atlantic, from the world's most powerful currents, ferocious hurricanes and huge chains of undersea volcanoes. The first episode looks at the influence of the Gulf Stream, with whales, giant turtles and jellyfish riding the huge current that becomes a migration super-highway and helps warm northern Europe, while fishermen battle for survival in mountainous seas as they try to exploit its natural fertility.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: James Lewis and Anita Manning begin their search for valuable items in Deddington Oxfordshire, before crossing into Hertfordshire for their auction in St Albans.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch Unsprung
programme.desc: Author Michael Morpurgo joins Chris Packham for a Warhorse-themed hide share, chef Michael Caines discusses his love for herons and lapwings and artist Darren Woodhead also pops in.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Genoa to the Brenner Pass - Part Two.
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey through Italy, from the Riviera to the Alps. This time, he takes in the OTS Virginio Fasan at La Spezia, an important Italian naval base. He also visits Parma to sample the city's signature cheese and ham, and takes a trip to the Teatro Regio opera, where a local company is rehearsing music by Verdi. Taking the fast train across the Po Valley, Michael heads toward the Alps, and hitches a ride in a modern Rolls Royce Dawn as he discovers how the car manufacturer secured its reputation on the winding roads of Rovereto in 1913.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The first of the Central region heats sees returning contender Pip Lacey and newcomers Ryan Simpson and Nick Deverell-Smith preparing their starters. They must impress a Great British Menu veteran if they are to cook for the judges in the regional final.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: In their final week at their base in the National Trust's Sherborne Park estate in Gloucestershire, Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan catch up on all the action that the nestcams have captured over the weekend. Plus, the first of four films about Somerset's colonies of little egrets.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Cyber Attack - The Day the NHS Stopped.
programme.desc: Kevin Fong reports on the recent ransomware attack that hit the NHS's computer system, telling the inside story of one of the most challenging days in the history of the health service. On the morning of May 12, appointment systems, pathology labs, X-ray machines and even CT Scanners were infected by the WannaCry virus, which locked all data and encrypted it. The only way to unscramble the files was to pay a ransom, with the hackers threatening to destroy all the data if the money was not forthcoming within a week.(n)

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Andy, Lance, Becky and Sophie's secrets are on the verge of being revealed, despite the fact they aren't talking to one another. Are they the victims of a smear campaign? Meanwhile, interest grows in Bishop's Farm. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook, Toby Jones, Rachael Stirling and Aimee-Ffion Edwards.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights
programme.desc: Sri Lanka v Pakistan. Action from the Group B encounter at the SWALEC Stadium, as the one-day competition continued.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater: Life Is Sweets
programme.desc: The food writer charts the origins of British sweets and chocolate, from medicinal medieval boiled candy to the treats that line supermarket shelves today. Nigel recalls his favourites from childhood, including a small toffee that inspired him to write his memoir, marshmallows that remind him of his mother and a travel sweet which conjures up visions of his father.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Motorway
programme.desc: How public opinion about Britain's motorways has changed since the first stretch was opened in 1958 to little opposition. The documentary explores the reaction to a plan for an elevated ring road through the heart of London and recalls the government's Roads for Prosperity project in the 1980s - scrapped after protests against the Twyford Down scheme gained significant media coverage. Philip Glenister narrates.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Secrets of the Solar System.
programme.desc: Planets are now being discovered outside Earth's solar system on a regular basis, and these strange new worlds are forcing scientists to rewrite the history of how the Sun and the planets, satellites, dwarf planets, asteroids and comets that orbit it came into being. This programme reveals that far from a simple story of stable objects orbiting a star, the development of the solar system was a potent combination of hellfire, chaos and planetary pinball that makes it somewhat of a miracle that Earth was created at all.(n)

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.sub-title: Inside God's Observatory: A Sky at Night Special.
programme.desc: A special programme from the Vatican's observatory, the Specola Vaticana, where Maggie Aderin-Pocock and Chris Lintott explore its history and contemporary cutting-edge science.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Star Men: Heroes of Astronomy
programme.desc: Four veteran British stargazers go on a road trip to celebrate 50 years of work and friendship, which represents a highly productive period in astronomy. Now in their 70s, they share their reflections on a life spent looking at the universe as they journey through the south-western United States, revisiting the places where they worked and the landscape they explored together as young men.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox takes a journey through the BBC science archive to explore the story of mankind's relationship with the moon, from James Burke testing Nasa equipment to Neil Armstrong's first steps on the lunar surface and the dramatic tale of Apollo 13. He also asks whether international competition could help reignite the public's enthusiasm for space travel and bring about the dawn of a new space age.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Great Events
programme.desc: David Attenborough describes the annual surge of more than 100 million sardines along South Africa's east coast as inshore waters cool with the arrival of winter. This marine spectacle provides a feast for competing predators including dolphins, whales, sharks and seabirds, but the sardine run has become less predictable in recent years - posing a threat to the creatures that depend on it to survive.(n)

programme.title: Engineering Giants
programme.desc: Tom Wrigglesworth and Rob Bell visit a dry dock in Newcastle, where they witness long-serving North Sea ferry the Pride of Bruges receiving a complete overhaul to extend its working life. The duo explore the inner workings of the 32,000-ton ship, which has transported passengers between Hull and the Belgian port of Zeebrugge for more than a quarter of a century, and travel to a ship-breaking yard to learn how ferries are recycled when they are no longer fit for service. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Star Men: Heroes of Astronomy
programme.desc: Four veteran British stargazers go on a road trip to celebrate 50 years of work and friendship, which represents a highly productive period in astronomy. Now in their 70s, they share their reflections on a life spent looking at the universe as they journey through the south-western United States, revisiting the places where they worked and the landscape they explored together as young men.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: High Street Kensington to London Bridge.
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on his final journey in London, exploring Albertopolis in south Kensington and reaching dizzying heights inside a Victorian landmark. At Vauxhall, he learns about the darker side of London's flower market in Bradshaw's day and ends at London Bridge, where two stations are becoming one and a new concourse is being built.(n)

programme.title: Pain, Pus & Poison: The Search for Modern Medicines
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how scientists exploited the natural world to make medicines, beginning by investigating the challenges they faced trying to create a drug that would alleviate pain. The programme examines what physical discomfort actually is, why people want to control it, and how the discovery of morphine led to 200 years of scientific breakthroughs and self-experimentation.(n)

programme.title: The Art of Japanese Life
programme.desc: New series. Historian James Fox explores the connections between Japanese culture and the natural world, examining the influence of the country's two major religions of Shintoism and Buddhism.(n)

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc: New series. Documentary about traditional Japanese craftspeople, beginning by following Shiro Kunimitsu and his family as they craft a katana of exceptional sharpness and durability, continuing a tradition begun by their ancestors nearly three centuries ago.(n)

programme.title: The Riviera: A History in Pictures
programme.desc: Richard E Grant concludes his exploration of the French Riviera's artistic legacy by focusing on how art and celebrity became intertwined in the early part of the 20th century. Resident artists such as Picasso and Matisse found the sun-drenched landscape ideal for experimenting with their work, and as the region became a creative hub, the likes of novelist Jean Cocteau and ballet impresario Sergei Diaghilev were drawn to the area. This artistic community also liked to party on the Cote d'Azur's beaches - a pastime that proved equally irresistible to the American multimillionaires arriving in the area on board transatlantic liners.(n)

programme.title: Francesco's Italy Top to Toe
programme.desc: Francesco da Mosto concludes his travels in the south of Italy, where his family has lived for 500 years. He explores the rock caves of Matera, attends Nocera's Easter celebrations and finds out about collapsible houses designed to help the residents avoid paying taxes. He also visits Sicily, where he takes a trip to Mount Etna and the catacombs of Palermo.(n)

The presenter also continues his German road trip with a visit to the Tyrolean mountains, where he finds a house that looks like a cross between a large bird and a UFO, and he and Will Hardie save a decrepit old wartime lookout shed to use as the basis for their floating beach hut.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: A Very British Hotel
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at London's Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park, located in the heart of Knightsbridge and one of the world's most exclusive hotels. It has been a favourite with royals from all around the globe, celebrities and the super-rich for more than 100 years, and the series starts with the hotel in the middle of its busy summer season. In the opening episode, the staff cater for an overseas royal visitor and her entourage, while coping with the challenges of facing directly onto one of the capital's busiest thoroughfares.(n)

programme.desc: The competition to find the ultimate cabin in the wild concludes with the grand finale. This week, an ambitious treehouse design takes on a stylish tin-clad construction with a major trick up its sleeve. Will Hardie travels to Wales to visit a former barn that has been transformed into a charming waterside retreat, while Dick and Will's own luxury cabin is completed and transported to Snowdonia. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Handmaid's Tale
programme.desc: Offred accompanies Serena Joy on a visit to see Ofwarren's baby, but she fears the new mother has become delusional when she confides that she thinks her commander is in love with her. Later Offred is taken away in a black van to be interrogated by an Eye and Aunt Lydia about her knowledge of Ofglen, who has been taken to a detention centre. In a flashback to the rise of Gilead, June and her female colleagues are fired and the government orders a freeze on bank accounts held by women. Elisabeth Moss stars.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The nation's favourite armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during a single week in December 2015, including The Royal Variety Performance, the Turner Prize, Meet the Psychopaths, I'm a Celebrity, Get Me Out of Here!, The Secret Life of 6 Year Olds, Single White Female and the news. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively - sometimes emotional - discussions from the comfort of their own homes.(n)

programme.title: Formula 1

programme.title: Grand Prix: The Killer Years
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the dangerous aspects of Formula One racing and the deaths that occurred at Grands Prix during the 1960s and early 70s. The film examines the boycotts organised by drivers and the lengthy battle they fought to achieve improvements in safety standards. Featuring contributions by three-time world champion Jackie Stewart, who was a leading campaigner for increases in the sport's safety, double champion Emerson Fittipaldi and John Surtees, who won titles on two and four wheels.(n)

programme.desc: A reckless car thief seems intent on causing carnage, while the pursuit of an unlicensed driver through a housing estate has grave consequences. programme.title: My Daughter Must Live
programme.desc: A woman discovers that her daughter needs a liver transplant, but medical tests reveal that her husband is not the girl's father. Thriller, starring Joelle Carter and Madeleine Martin.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Dan and Gordy engage in the high-speed pursuit of a dangerous disqualified driver, while the big blue van is called in when a late-night scuffle spirals out of control, Jim's intuition is proven right after a routine stop reveals a secret stash, and the hunt is on for a wanted man in a bobble hat.(n)

programme.title: The Philpott Fire: 5 Years On
programme.desc: In May 2012, Mick Philpott started a fire in his own house which killed six children, five of them his own, and was jailed for life for manslaughter in April the following year. This documentary looks at the aftermath of the tragedy and features interviews with one of Philpott's sons, close family members, friends and neighbours.(n)

programme.desc: As the end of the first Gulf War nears, a group of adventurous American soldiers attempt to find a huge cache of hidden Iraqi gold. Action(n)
