programme.desc: A Peruvian drug lord is forced to move out of his mother's house(n)

programme.title: Magnum Force
programme.desc: Dirty Harry is on the trail of vigilante cops who are not above going beyond the law to kill the city's undesirables(n)

programme.title: The Brothers Grimm
programme.desc: Con artists Will and Jake Grimm (Matt Damon and Heath Ledger) encounter a genuine fairy-tale curse that requires more than their usual fakery(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: The third entry in the popular pulp-adventure series finds Rick O'Connell and wife, Evelyn, in 1940s China with their now-adult son, Alex . Together they battle a centuries-old Chinese emperor and his undead army(n)

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: Former LA cop Brian now makes his living driving in illegal street races in Miami. Squeezed by the FBI, he agrees to set up druglord Verone for a king-sized bust. Action(n)

programme.title: Trainwreck
programme.desc: A commitment-phobic binge drinker living in New York City must reevaluate her feelings about intimate relationships when a sports doctor pursues a romance with her(n)

programme.title: National Lampoon's Animal House
programme.desc: John Landis directed this rollicking early '60s nostalgia piece reportedly based on screenwriter Chris Miller's real-life experiences as a freshman at prestigious Dartmouth College. Unable to gain acceptance at the snootier fraternities they pledge, Frosh losers Thomas Hulce and Stephen Furst find a home among the Deltas, a motley crew of misfits and sociopaths bent on disrupting the well-starched status quo. Led by seniors (Tim Matheson) and (Peter Riegert), the Delta boys engage in various illegalities that land them in hot water with both the stern college dean (John Vernon) and the neighboring jock fraternity. Their exploits eventually cause them to be placed on "double-secret probation;" finally, they are kicked out of school and, as the dean reminds them, newly eligible for the Vietnam draft. What follows is an anarchic subversion of the annual town parade -- not to mention some genuine hilarity -- as the Deltas raid the festivities for revenge, causing all hell to break loose. While parts of Animal House are uneven, some scenes are side-splittingly funny, particularly the scene in which malcontent literature professor Donald Sutherland smokes pot with his students and discusses some heavy metaphysics. However, the real reason to watch the film is John Belushi as Bluto Blutarsky, the seventh-year senior with a poor memory for world history and a penchant for drinking fifths of Jack Daniels in one draught -- he is spectacular. His memorable performance solidifies his place as one of American cinema's most outrageous comedic performers, in spite of the brevity of his career. In all, Animal House is a highly amusing comedy, sure to bring back memories for anyone who's been to college (even if they never did manage to graduate)(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: Thomas, Teresa, and the rest of the Gladers prepare for phase two of their maze trials after narrowly escaping the first test in this young-adult dystopian sequel(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Nicole Kidman and Hugh Jackman find love in the Outback in Baz Luhrmann's sweeping(n)

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious
programme.desc: Buckle up for a wild ride as Paul Walker ("Joy Ride") and Vin Diesel ("Pitch Black") put the pedal to the metal in this high-octane action thriller. Diesel plays the leader of a gang of L.A. street racers who moonlight in highway robbery; Walker is the undercover cop who befriends him. Michelle Rodriguez, Jordana Brewster, Rick Yune, Chad Lindberg(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: An experiment to create a girl who is half-human half-alien goes awry when she breaks out of the lab(n)

programme.title: Ricochet
programme.desc: A cop receives lots of media attention when he nabs an infamous, sadistic killer at an amusement park. The murderer stews in jail for seven years, obsessively following the rising career of his arresting officer, who becomes a DA with a promising future, a husband, and a dad. This doesn't sit well with the vengeful convict, who after escaping from prison, puts into play a series of fiendish plots in an attempt to destroy the attorney's marriage and career..(n)

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Two ageing friends, one a retired composer and the other a filmmaker working on a new project, go on holiday together at a spa resort in the Alps. There, they take stock of their lives and reflect on their artistic accomplishments(n)

programme.title: The Bone Collector
programme.desc: Edgy detective thriller starring Angelina Jolie and Denzel Washington, 1999. A brilliant forensics expert, paralysed in an accident, must hunt down a serial killer in Manhattan(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Seafaring adventure as, during the Napoleonic wars, a British frigate is sent to track and engage a larger French warship, the Acheron, off the coast of South America. The intense and duty-driven captain of the British vessel must try to coax his war-weary crew to victory, amid a series of explosive naval battle scenes. Based on the novels by Patrick O'Brian(n)

programme.title: Mercury Rising
programme.desc: A renegade FBI agent (Bruce Willis) races against time and the government when a 9-year-old autistic boy cracks a national-security code. Directed by Harold Becker and based on the novel "Simple Simon" by Ryne Douglas Pearson. Alec Baldwin, Miko Hughes, Chi McBride, Kim Dickens(n)

programme.title: Undercover Brother
programme.desc: Everyone knows it takes an Undercover Brother to foil The Man. This time, The Man has launched Operation Whitewash, a plot to undermine an African-American general's presidential ambitions. But with the Undercover Brother (Eddie Griffin) on the case, alongside his sexy sidekick, Sistah Girl (Aunjanue Ellis), the general is sure to see the inside of the Oval Office. The 70's fashion-fabulous duo dons the latest in country club attire to infiltrate The Man's plan and root out his evil accomplice the White She Devil (Denise Richards)(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Futuristic science fiction thriller about a detective who works for a police department that uses three infallible psychics to help convict murderers before they have actually committed their crimes. When the detective discovers that he has been identified as a future killer, he becomes a fugitive from his own colleagues. Based on a short story by Philip K Dick(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An FBI agent goes undercover and infiltrates a group of extreme athletes in order to prove they are using their specialised skills to pull off a series of complex crimes. The film is inspired by the 1991 cult hit of the same name(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: (2008) Angelina Jolie, James McAvoy and Morgan Freeman star in this violent action adventure from Russian director Timur Bekmambetov (Nightwatch, Daywatch). The life of office worker Wesley Gibson (McAvoy) has been one of frustration, disappointment and anxiety; he has an overbearing boss, his girlfriend and his best friend are duplicitously having an affair, and he's on medication to calm his nerves. To top it all, he one day finds himself on the wrong end of an assassination attempt. Luckily, the agile, honed and lethal Fox (Jolie) is at hand to save his life. However, she also reveals that his recently deceased father was secretly a supremely skilled killer, and that it's her job to ensure that Wesley takes his place in the Fraternity, the mystical organisation overseen by Sloan (Freeman), which exists to rid the world of evil-doers. And so begins Wesley's journey to unlock his hitherto unsuspected innate deadly abilities and use them for good. The cinematography echoes the inventiveness of Bekmambetov's earlier movies and takes a Matrix-like delight in playing with the tempo and camera angles of the fight scenes(n)

programme.title: Final Destination
programme.desc: Death is coming. And Alex Browning is cursed with knowing when, how and where the grim reaper will take his next victim to the Final Destination. After boarding a plane to Europe with his fellow French club members, high school student Alex Browning has a premonition of the aircraft exploding moments after takeoff, killing every on board. Alex panics, insisting that everyone get off the plane. In the melee than ensues, seven people, including Alex, are forced to disembark--saving them from a fiery death when the plan explodes as Alex foresaw. But as, one by one, each of these seven who cheated fate meets an untimely end, Alex and his remaining friends band together to try change destiny and outwit the untamable forces of death. Starring Devon Sawa, Ali Larter & Kerr Smith(n)

programme.title: Gran Torino
programme.desc: Disgruntled Korean War vet Walt Kowalski sets out to reform his neighbour, a young Hmong teenager, who tried to steal Kowalski's prized possession: his 1972 Gran Torino(n)

programme.desc: Friction continues between an aspiring cop and his seasoned partner (and future brother-in-law) as they pursue a Miami drug lord together with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.desc: Eric's Stash. Eric accuses Hyde of stealing his stash of money; Kelso and Fez help Jackie prepare for a beauty pageant(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Hunting. Red and Eric try to bond on a hunting trip with the guys, while the women back home play a friendly game of poker instead of discussing Donna and Eric. Red: Kurtwood Smith. Midge: Tanya Roberts. Eric: Topher Grace. Fez: Wilmer Valderrama. Kelso: Ashton Kutcher. Hyde: Danny Masterson(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: This TV sitcom takes the viewer back to the world of leisure suits, smiley-face buttons, and Farrah Fawcett-Majors posters. In 1976 in Point Place, WI, 17-year-old Eric Forman (Topher Grace) tries to wiggle free of his neurotic parents, Red (Kurtwood Smith) and Kitty (Debra Jo Rupp), in order to connect with his funkedelic friends -- his cute neighbor Donna Pinciotti (Laura Prepon), his best buddy Michael Kelso (Ashton Kutcher), Kelso's girlfriend, Jackie Burkhart (Mila Kunis), paranoid Steve Hyde (Danny Masterson), and foreign-exchange student Fez (Wilmer Valderrama). Filmed in L.A., the series premiered August 23, 1998, on FOX(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Burning Down the House. Jackie's plans for a classy dinner become crass thanks to Kelso's liberal guest policy; Red sees Bob without a vital accoutrement(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: The First Time. Donna has finally made Eric a man; he's overjoyed about it until he hears that things didn't go as well as he thought they had(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Afterglow. Contrary to what she tells Eric, Donna's review of their first sexual encounter is not good---or private; Red celebrates his first paycheck and buys a motorcycle(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Parents Find Out. Kitty is devastated after the police catch Donna and Eric having sex in the Vista Cruiser(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Kiss of Death. Jackie catches Kelso kissing Laurie; Fez has emergency surgery; Eric hits Donna's cat(n)

programme.desc: Kelso's Serenade. Kelso tries to win Jackie back with a song; Kitty drags the family to see elderly Aunt Pearl; Donna thinks Eric takes her for granted(n)

programme.channel: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)
programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Free to Murder Again. The Texas penal system wakes up from a nightmare in the A&E program American Justice: Free to Murder Again. The subject of the documentary is serial killer Kenneth McDuff, the biggest mistake the parole board ever made. McDuff was first sentenced to death in 1968 for killing three teenagers. Seemingly, his incarceration meant the end of his murder spree. But due to the overcrowding of Texas jails, McDuff was eventually released after serving only 21 years. Soon, the criminal was back on the streets harassing children and adults alike. In 1991, McDuff abducted and killed a young woman only to repeat the pattern two years later with a pregnant mother of two. When he was captured and resentenced to death, his murderous trail was reported to include a handful of others. McDuff's situation alerted the government to the failures of the parole boards. His case eventually resulted in a slew of new prison constructions and tough law reforms(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Stevie questions a man arrested for launching an unprovoked attack on a fellow drinker in a pub and becomes emotionally involved when she discovers the suspect is deeply depressed after losing his job and learning his wife has been having an affair with her boss. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. A child abandoned in a busy market alerts police to the fact his nanny has been abducted and badly beaten in what turns out to be a case of mistaken identity. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. When psychiatrist Julia Bickham's partner is injured in a hit-and-run incident and her nanny is attacked in what turns out to be a case of mistaken identity, Neil investigates the possibility somebody holds a grudge against her. Among the suspects is a man whose wife died two years previously from an overdose. On the strength of Julia's professional testimony that it was a case of suicide, the man lost his life assurance claim and subsequently custody of his daughter.(n)

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: Charity Wakefield and Hattie Morahan lead the cast in Andrew Davies's adaptation of Jane Austen's classic novel about a voyage of sexual and romantic discovery. Following the death of her husband, Mrs Dashwood and her daughters are forced to give up their home and move to a small cottage in Devonshire. Elinor is disappointed to leave her old home after falling in love with Edward Ferrars, her sister-in-law's brother, but looks forward to a promised visit. Marianne quickly finds she has an admirer in Colonel Brandon but is swept of her feet by neighbour Willoughby.(n)

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: Colonel Brandon is called away on urgent business, leaving Marianne free to fall blissfully in love with Willoughby - until he too suddenly leaves for London. Meanwhile, Elinor has a disappointing meeting with Edward, but the reasons for his distant behaviour become clear when Sir John's niece Lucy Steele entrusts her with a shocking secret.(n)

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Man Who Cried
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama about Abel Mason, an ordinary working man whose extramarital affair leads to murder, and prompts him to hit the road with his son in search of a new life. The pair head north and Abel eventually finds employment with a wealthy garage owner. Ciaran Hinds and Kate Buffery star.(n)

programme.title: The Musketeers
programme.desc: Drama set in 17th-century Paris, following the adventures of the soldiers assigned to protect king and country. Young swordsman d'Artagnan arrives in Paris seeking out the man responsible for killing his father - a quest that brings him into conflict with one of the king's guards. But as he quickly discovers, when you take on one Musketeer, you take on them all. It's soon back to business when the swashbuckling heroes are ordered to find a missing soldier who was carrying important letters on behalf of King Louis, while the dastardly Cardinal Richelieu plots to increase his political power. Luke Pasqualino, Tom Burke, Howard Charles and Santiago Cabrera star as d'Artagnan, Athos, Porthos and Aramis, with Peter Capaldi as Richelieu. Based on the characters created by Alexandre Dumas.(n)

programme.title: The Mrs Bradley Mysteries

When she and her chauffeur George investigate, they uncover a tangled web of skulduggery and secret affairs. Detective drama, based on the novel by Gladys Mitchell, starring Diana Rigg, Neil Dudgeon, Peter Davison and David Tennant.(n)

It seems the detective is right when another young man is found dead at the scene of the original crime. Has Nikki helped to free a serial killer? programme.desc: Hector is so incensed by the sudden arrival of his pregnant daughter Lizzie that he decides to disown her. Meanwhile, Archie races to reconcile his feuding family, and Katrina faces a difficult decision. Light-hearted Scottish drama, starring Richard Briers and Susan Hampshire.(n)

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James saves the life of a calf, but finds the difficult delivery easier than accepting the farmer's gratitude. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Peter Davison, and featuring an appearance by 'Allo 'Allo's Gorden Kaye.(n)

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Council spending cuts spell the end for Tom and Diana's art class, so the enterprising pensioners organise a studio of their own at Bayview and rope Harvey in to act as their model. Comedy, starring Stephanie Cole and Graham Crowden.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Rights of Man (Except for Howard).
programme.desc: Hobbo tells Howard to stand up for himself if he still wants Pearl to take him back - but his wife pours cold water on his attempts to impress her. Marina decides to seize the moment with Mr Waddle, and the police pull Tom over for driving too slowly, only to end up sharing his bacon sandwiches. Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan star.(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Daisy tries to encourage Onslow to notice her by picking up a toy boy in the hope of making him jealous. Meanwhile, Hyacinth forces Elizabeth and Richard to help her organise a social occasion at the church hall. Patricia Routledge and Judy Cornwell star.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A 79-year-old woman with dementia runs away from her care home and turns up at a south London police station to report a murder - sparking a reinvestigation into the mysterious disappearance of her police officer husband in 1956. The official report says that he fell into the river after one too many beers - but what secrets was this seemingly straight-as-a die old-fashioned bobby keeping? Meanwhile, Steve's son is arrested for buying weed, bringing the retired cop face to face with his ex-wife - a woman he hasn't seen in 10 years. Tamzin Outhwaite and Denis Lawson star, with a guest appearance from Julie Graham.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Holiday-maker Megan Talbot confesses to shooting dead her husband, but puzzlingly there isn't a body - and without a victim, Richard has little to go on, insisting nothing is definite without hard evidence. But then a local boat crew fish a corpse out of the sea, with two gunshot wounds to the head - just as Megan said. Miranda Raison (Sugartown) and Neil Stuke (Silk) guest star in the Caribbean crime drama, with Ben Miller and Sara Martins.(n)

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team flies out to Zambia to investigate the death of a female doctor who disappeared two weeks earlier. It transpires the woman was volunteering for a Mission and had believed a number of refugees died in suspicious circumstances. Leo and Nikki carry out a post-mortem, but their findings throw the case into disarray. Patrick Baladi and Robert Pugh guest star.(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: Family Trippin Pt. 2. Conclusion. After the family confront Scott about his unwelcome guest in Costa Rica, Kourtney must inform him that he's ruined any chance of them ever getting back together. Meanwhile, Khloe is fed up with her family's bad attitude(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Riley is confined to the sofa under doctor's orders not to exert herself, while Ben is upset when Emma begins to ask questions about her mother. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ben and Ambika kick off the competition in Hertfordshire with a south-east Asian menu. Their guests are Sinead from Northern Ireland and her prank-loving partner Tony, and competitive couple Kally and Mark. The lads bond over football, and by the end of the night Tony has played a prank or two setting the tone for the week. Subsequently, Kally and Mark put on an Anglo-Indian menu, but things soon get heated in the kitchen. Then, Tony and Sinead serve up an Irish menu, with silly dances, silly jokes and silly accents. However, it remains to be seen which couple will pocket the prize for best soiree.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In north Devon, married couple Frankie and husband Jason kick off the competition. Outspoken duo Kate and Ian don't let the evening's many delays go unnoticed, and as tensions rise around the table, internet lovebirds Chris and Amy try to stay firmly out of the way. Day two sees Kate and Ian serve up a menu full of rustic French cuisine, influenced by their 22 years living in France. But a table laying mishap suggests that Kate has overtly snubbed her guests, although tensions are eased when former falconers Kate and Ian bring out one of their favourite birds of prey. Finally it's dog lovers Chris and Amy's turn to step up to the plate, and believing themselves to be the foodies of the group they're confident they can bag the prize for best soiree.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Omnibus. Grace and Warren end up in a tricky situation when two armed thugs handcuff them to a pipe in the office of The Loft. Meanwhile, Darcy is still playing games with Jesse, and Esther spots a hooded figure watching her and gives chase.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess tries to impress the president of the parents' council in her bid to become school headmistress. Winston puts his undercover skills to the test. Zooey Deschanel stars.(n)

programme.desc: Kevin runs into his old partner and tries to reconnect, but is shocked to find out he has been replaced by a younger, more impressive, young cop.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake and Rosa try to earn the respect of their idol. US cop comedy, starring Andy Samberg and Stephanie Beatriz, with a guest appearance from Gina Gerson.(n)

programme.title: Turner & Hooch
programme.desc: A Californian detective investigating the murder of a local man by drug smugglers has only one witness to help him solve the case - the large, smelly dog that belonged to the victim, which is about to turn the detective's well-ordered existence into chaos. Family comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Mare Winningham and Craig T Nelson.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam risks bodily harm during an intense game of paintball to impress his latest crush, and Erica pretends she has a college-aged boyfriend.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon helps Leonard drop off a parcel for Penny, but when he sees how messy her room is, he tries to do a good deed - which is not well received. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is upset to learn Penny is dating someone, so his friends and fellow scientists encourage him to seek a new romance by asking another woman out. Guest starring Sara Gilbert (Roseanne), with Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard returns from his research expedition in the North Sea and undergoes an adjustment period with Sheldon. Howard experiences an unusual emotional reaction as a result of his relationship with his mother. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg star.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends compete in a scavenger hunt designed by Raj to test their scientific knowledge and life skills, but the game brings out the best and worst in everyone. As the hunt progresses, Howard and Amy begin to bond over their shared musical tastes, while Penny and Sheldon work together as a team and Bernadette becomes fiercely competitive.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Tensions emerge between the guys as they struggle to complete their Air Force project on time, and Raj discovers how Bernadette really feels about her pregnancy.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard and Bernadette decide they do not want to know the gender of their unborn child, but are upset when they hear Raj has found out before they have. After Amy's apartment floods, she proposes a cohabition experiment with Sheldon to stay with him while her apartment undergoes repairs.(n)

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: The trainee crew members of the starship Enterprise embark on their maiden flight, which pits them against a Romulan commander from the future who is planning a horrific revenge on those he blames for a tragedy in his own time. Sci-fi adventure based on the original TV series, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto, Eric Bana, Zoe Saldana and Leonard Nimoy.(n)

programme.title: Marvel's Agents of SHIELD

programme.desc: Alex Zane's countdown of internet clips includes a sleepover in a popular furniture shop, a mint-based rocket to the face, and a rarely seen BMX stunt.(n)

programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Line of Duty, Mary Berry's Easter Feast, Saturday Night Takeaway, University Challenge, Big Little Lies, The Toilet: An Unspoken History, The Dog with an IQ of 102, and the News.(n)

programme.desc: Jamie flies a group of single friends to join Spencer and Alex's holiday, while Andy and Jamie vie for new girl Lauren's attention. Back in London, Steph and Josh adjust to moving in together, and Binky considers meeting Alex's new girlfriend.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Jeff and Audrey land themselves in a financial mess when they accidentally overspend on a night out. Adam is upset by Russell who decides to teach him a lesson, and by Jennifer who names someone else as her emergency contact. Patrick Warburton and Oliver Hudson star.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Jeff decides to flirt with a colleague, but when she indicates she wants an affair, he accidentally sends a text message to Audrey trying to put her off becoming involved with him. Russell asks Timmy to retrieve his mobile phone from the apartment where he spent the night with a female friend.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey

Meanwhile, Lennox and her nemesis are forced to work on a school project together. Starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Despite everything that has happened to him over the past year, Joe decides to go to his college reunion to see his former classmates. However, when his date for the event cancels on him, Mel feels she must try to find a solution to the problem. Meanwhile, Lennox and Ryder plan to throw a party. Starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Riley invites Ben to be her date at a work party, but his efforts to prove he is dependable fall short, and Danny hopes to come to her rescue instead. Meanwhile, Tucker schemes to go out with a model, and Bonnie attempts to get to know a handsome stranger. Starring Jean-Luc Bilodeau.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Ben discovers a shocking secret about Riley's new love Fitch, while things heat up between Danny and girlfriend Milena, and Tucker seizes an opportunity to impress his boss Chase. Comedy, starring Jean-Luc Bilodeau.(n)

programme.desc: Ted is torn between his architectural aspirations and his relationship with Zoey when he is called in front of a meeting to determine the future of the Arcadian - and his decision becomes even more complicated when he discovers Barney's job could be at risk. Comedy, starring Josh Radnor and Neil Patrick Harris.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted begins to have doubts over his ability to complete the Arcadian project - and Barney and Robin are horrified to realise he is considering getting back together with Zoey. Marshall secures an interview for his dream job, but is forced to fight off the effects of food poisoning. Comedy, starring Josh Radnor, with Chi McBride (Pushing Daisies) and Dave Foley (Kids in the Hall).(n)

programme.desc: Jess and Nick try to keep their break-up a secret, and Winston wants to celebrate after being accepted into the LAPD. Meanwhile, Schmidt helps Cece with her GED training. Sitcom, starring Zooey Deschanel.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: When Jess is asked to organise a dance for the students at her school, she soon comes to suspect that somebody is trying to sabotage her efforts. Determined to make the event a success, she enlists the gang to help her chaperone on the big night. Sitcom, starring Zooey Deschanel.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: For the first time in his career, Jake has a growing number of cases he just can't seem to solve, and the other detectives worry his run of bad luck will rub off on them. Holt asks Amy to take charge of a community outreach programme for at-risk youths, and Boyle helps Jeffords with a tough personal assignment. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg and Andre Braugher.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake meets an attractive medical examiner at a crime scene, but annoys his colleagues when his attempts to get together with her cause a hold-up with an autopsy report. Meanwhile, Amy discovers Jeffords has some hidden talents when the police sketch artist goes off sick.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is uninterested in Amy's career, so Penny, Raj and Leonard try to make him understand that sometimes it benefits a relationship to pretend to care about a partner's achievements. Howard notices Bernadette is uncomfortable around children when she helps him perform a magic show at his nephew's birthday party.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard asks Penny out on a date, and they agree to give their relationship another chance. They soon remember why it did not work out in the first place, but end up sleeping together anyway. The 100th episode of the comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted and Barney decide to adopt a child together when they become fed up with women during Thanksgiving. However, they soon spiral into couple-like behaviour and have an argument. Elsewhere, Marshall and Lily agree to move to the suburbs.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Robin pays a visit to the doctor, hoping to confirm whether she is actually pregnant, but does not receive the test results she expected and tries to keep the news from her friends. Meanwhile, Marshall is determined to dazzle his neighbourhood with a spectacular set of Christmas lights, and enlists a local lad to help set up his display. However, he remains unaware the youngster has an ulterior motive.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: When a new bar opens in the neighbourhood, it becomes the final piece of the puzzle for Nick's epic Valentine's Day pub crawl. Jess and Ryan drunkenly contemplate their future, Coach meets a new woman - several times over - and Schmidt tries to fit into the world of politics.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess takes a bumpy stroll down memory lane when she and the gang travel to her childhood home in Portland, Oregon, for her father's wedding. With Ryan back in England, everyone is worried that his relationship with Jess is nearing its end, but she is determined to make it work. Jamie Lee Curtis and Rob Reiner guest star.(n)

programme.title: 2 Broke Girls
programme.desc: Deke takes Max back to his place after a great first date, but his living arrangements are not as she expects. Meanwhile, Caroline has a suspicious car towed away from outside the cupcake shop and becomes convinced its owner is out to get her. Comedy, starring Kat Dennings and Beth Behrs.(n)

programme.title: 2 Broke Girls
programme.sub-title: And the Icing on the Cake.
programme.desc: Deke invites Max's friends to a party at his makeshift home as their relationship becomes more serious. However, Caroline discovers a secret about Deke's background while she continues to fend off the advances of chef Nicolas. Comedy, starring Kat Dennings and Beth Behrs.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Sheldon and Raj organise a stag party for Howard, but stories about his sexual history are unwittingly revealed, and he has to persuade bride-to-be Bernadette not to call off the wedding. Comedy, starring Simon Helberg and Kunal Nayyar.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard tries to use his wedding as an excuse to avoid being sent into space, but ends up accepting the mission. Amy plots to get Sheldon to take the next step in their relationship, while Leonard accidentally asks Penny to marry him.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Mercedes and Diane come across some video footage taken by Scott and are stunned by what they discover, so they make their way to the hospital. When they arrive, Scott is now conscious and sat up in bed, although the light has gone from his eyes.(n)

programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: Dre is excited about working on an advertising campaign with a rap star, while Rainbow tries to persuade the family to stop eating so much takeaway food. With Chris Brown.(n)

programme.title: Avatar
programme.desc: A paraplegic soldier uses technology that allows him to control a genetically engineered body on a mission to a dangerous jungle world. His assignment is to infiltrate an alien tribe on behalf of a corrupt mining corporation, which wants to drive them from their land. He comes to sympathise with the natives, and helps them fight back against his employers. James Cameron's sci-fi adventure, starring Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldana, Sigourney Weaver and Stephen Lang.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is fired for being disrespectful to his boss, and explores new activities in a bid to find a purpose in life other than physics, but Leonard takes drastic action to restore him to his old self. Laurie Metcalf guest stars as Sheldon's mother.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard fears he is wasting his time with Penny and ends up spending the night with fellow scientist Leslie. However, he is disappointed when she later tells him she was only interested in a one-night stand. Meanwhile, Sheldon frets over a change to his hamburger routine. Starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons.(n)

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship program provides a thorough presentation of sports news, highlights and analysis. The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, 'Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia(n)

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: A lively sports-talk show features opinionated reporters debating topical headlines. An on-screen 'rundown' of the topics is a signature of the series, which also includes guests in and out of the studio, and responses to viewer calls and e-mail(n)

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted--or rather, refereed--by boxing expert Max Kellerman, this lively cable-TV discussion show featured four sports columnists, each from a different part of the USA, discussing recent pro-athletic developments in a sort of electronic summit meeting. Kellerman determined how much time each of the columnists would be permitted to express his or her opinions--and he was harsh indeed, frequently limiting the discourse to ten seconds or less. At the end of the show, Kellerman would award points for the most cogent opinions and arguments, and also subtract points from contributors whom he determined had not effectively expressed themselves. The inagural episode of ESPN's Around the Horn was seen on September 30, 2002(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Lost Land of the Jaguar
programme.desc: Scientists, climbers and wildlife film-makers explore the rainforests of Guyana, a former British colony in South America. Cameraman Gordon Buchanan finds giant otters almost as large as he is, canopy expert Justine Evans observes a family of red howler monkeys, and biologist Steve Backshall probes a habitat below a massive waterfall where frogs and freshwater crabs happily co-exist.(n)

programme.title: Lost Land of the Jaguar
programme.desc: The team travels deeper into the Guyanan jungle and scorpions and poisonous centipedes enter the base camp. Gordon Buchanan discovers an animal is stealing supplies and Steve Backshall finds giant piranha and long-fanged sabretooth fish in the river. Meanwhile, George McGavin catches an enormous tarantula and the climbing team tries to scale a huge unclimbed mountain at the forest's edge.(n)

programme.title: Lost Land of the Jaguar
programme.desc: Steve Backshall reaches the summit of a table-top mountain, after climbing a vertical cliff face nearly as high as the Empire State Building. Meanwhile, Dr George McGavin and Gordon Buchanan have to haul three boats and all their kit through the jungle after finding the rapids of the Rewa River impassable. At the end of the journey, George presents a report on the expedition to the President of Guyana, Bharrat Jagdeo. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Lost Land of the Volcano
programme.desc: Scientists and wildlife film-makers led by Steve Backshall, George McGavin and Gordon Buchanan explore Mount Bosavi, a giant extinct volcano covered by thick and largely unexplored rainforest in New Guinea. With the help of trackers from a remote tribe, they search for rare creatures and species to find evidence that may help stop the area's trees being felled for timber. The nest of the world's smallest parrot, an unusual beetle and new types of frog, gecko and bat are among the team's first discoveries.(n)

programme.title: Lost Land of the Volcano
programme.desc: The team pushes deeper into the rainforest on the tropical island of New Guinea, where cameraman Gordon Buchanan enlists the aid of local tribespeople to help him film birds of paradise performing their unusual courtship ritual. George McGavin has to contend with a giant crocodile, and Steve Backshall discovers a hidden network of caves never previously seen by humans.(n)

programme.title: Lost Land of the Volcano
programme.desc: With the team's explorations of New Guinea drawing to a close, George McGavin visits an erupting volcano, where he encounters a rare bird that depends on the hot ash to survive. Back at the original site, Steve Backshall and Gordon Buchanan head deep into the crater and discover two new mammals - a giant rat and a tree-climbing marsupial.(n)

programme.desc: The team travels deeper into the Guyanan jungle and scorpions and poisonous centipedes enter the base camp. Gordon Buchanan discovers an animal is stealing supplies and Steve Backshall finds giant piranha and long-fanged sabretooth fish in the river. Meanwhile, George McGavin catches an enormous tarantula and the climbing team tries to scale a huge unclimbed mountain at the forest's edge.(n)

programme.title: Lost Land of the Jaguar
programme.desc: Steve Backshall reaches the summit of a table-top mountain, after climbing a vertical cliff face nearly as high as the Empire State Building. Meanwhile, Dr George McGavin and Gordon Buchanan have to haul three boats and all their kit through the jungle after finding the rapids of the Rewa River impassable. At the end of the journey, George presents a report on the expedition to the President of Guyana, Bharrat Jagdeo. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Lost Land of the Volcano
programme.desc: Scientists and wildlife film-makers led by Steve Backshall, George McGavin and Gordon Buchanan explore Mount Bosavi, a giant extinct volcano covered by thick and largely unexplored rainforest in New Guinea. With the help of trackers from a remote tribe, they search for rare creatures and species to find evidence that may help stop the area's trees being felled for timber. The nest of the world's smallest parrot, an unusual beetle and new types of frog, gecko and bat are among the team's first discoveries.(n)

programme.title: Lost Land of the Volcano
programme.desc: The team pushes deeper into the rainforest on the tropical island of New Guinea, where cameraman Gordon Buchanan enlists the aid of local tribespeople to help him film birds of paradise performing their unusual courtship ritual. George McGavin has to contend with a giant crocodile, and Steve Backshall discovers a hidden network of caves never previously seen by humans.(n)

programme.title: Lost Land of the Volcano
programme.desc: With the team's explorations of New Guinea drawing to a close, George McGavin visits an erupting volcano, where he encounters a rare bird that depends on the hot ash to survive. Back at the original site, Steve Backshall and Gordon Buchanan head deep into the crater and discover two new mammals - a giant rat and a tree-climbing marsupial.(n)

programme.title: Wild Justice
programme.desc: It is abalone season on the northern coast of California and the wardens have their hands full stemming the tide of black market poachers. Inland, they confront people who are illegally keeping a shark in a pet shop. Meanwhile, a rookie assigned to the Los Angeles beat snares lobster catchers off the Venice pier.(n)

programme.title: Surfer, Dude
programme.desc: Hands on a Hard Body director S.R. Bindler directs this wave-twisting tale of a soul-searching surfer (Matthew McConaughey) in the midst of an existential crisis. Steve Addington (McConaughey) is an herb-toking long-boarder with a keen sense of balance and a mellow outlook on life. Upon returning to his hometown of Malibu to spend the summer with old friends, Steve begins to sense that the good vibes he remembers as a boy have been hopelessly corrupted by the powers that be. When the earthen surfer is faced with the prospect of expanding into virtual-reality video games and reality television or risk being rendered irrelevant, he opts to keep riding the majestic Southern California waves rather than participate in this new digital reality. Fate seems to intercede, however, when the ocean simply ceases to produce any suitable waves. His finances dried up, his sponsored expense accounts suddenly canceled, and his friends flocking off to bluer pastures, the surfer without a wave suddenly realizes that he has but two choices in life: he can either sit tight and try to keep his sanity until the waves come rolling in again, or finally give in to the Man and his intoxicating world of artificial amusements. Perhaps with a little wisdom from his trusted manager (Woody Harrelson), his aging mentor (Scott Glenn), his guardian angel (Willie Nelson), and his newfound muse (Alexie Gilmore), Addington can somehow manage to maintain his mellow just long enough to put it all into perspective and get back to the basics(n)

programme.title: Let's Go to Prison
programme.desc: Nelson Biederman IV, the son of a judge ends up being sentenced to serve time in Rossmore State Penitentiary. During one of his rare stints out of incarceration, career criminal John Lyshitski learns of the conviction. John holds a grudge against Nelson's father and decides to get his revenge by going back to jail and making Nelson's stay there as horrible as possible(n)

programme.title: Sweet Home Alabama
programme.desc: Melanie only has to sort out one final detail before her glitzy marriage to the son of New York's mayor: her divorce papers from Jake. The childhood sweethearts split years ago, but Mel soon finds out that the spark is still there. Romantic comedy(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the dinosaurs never went extinct, a young Apatosaurus is swept away by a vicious river current and ends up far from home. He soon embarks on a journey to reunite with his family, and befriends a prehistoric human child along the way(n)

programme.title: Stargate
programme.desc: An interstellar teleportation device, found in Egypt, leads to a planet with humans resembling ancient Egyptians who worship the god Ra(n)

programme.title: High Noon
programme.desc: Classic, Oscar-winning Western starring Gary Cooper as a marshal prepared to kill in order to defend his town from a murderous criminal heading his way on the midday train. Even without the support of his townspeople or his own wife, Cooper digs in, waiting out the heat and his own doubts for a high noon confrontation(n)

programme.title: The Skulls
programme.desc: Joshua Jackson stars in this thriller as a poor undergraduate at an exclusive college who's tapped for a centuries-old secret society, and finds out the hard way that membership does indeed have its privileges. Leslie Bibb, Hill Harper, Paul Walker, Craig T. Nelson, William Petersen(n)

programme.title: Drop Zone
programme.desc: Skydiving ace Ty Moncrief lands on federal buildings and steals files containing the names of undercover agents which he sells to drug barons. Pete Nessip is the marshal who takes to the air to bring him down. Action(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon
programme.desc: Romantic comedy from the makers of Notting Hill. Peter Colt is a low-ranking tennis star whose misfortune on the court is only matched by his extremely bad luck in love. His life is transformed, however, when he is chosen as a wildcard to play at Wimbledon and, while there, meets and falls in love with a young American on the women's circuit. Their love match spurs him on to reach the tournament final, but will his good fortune hold out long enough for him to lift the prestigious trophy?(n)

programme.title: Let's Go to Prison
programme.desc: Nelson Biederman IV, the son of a judge ends up being sentenced to serve time in Rossmore State Penitentiary. During one of his rare stints out of incarceration, career criminal John Lyshitski learns of the conviction. John holds a grudge against Nelson's father and decides to get his revenge by going back to jail and making Nelson's stay there as horrible as possible(n)

programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: (2002) Martin Scorsese's multi-Oscar-nominated epic stars Daniel Day-Lewis as William Cutting, the leader of a violent gang in 19th-century New York who take on their rivals, led by "Priest" Vallon (Liam Neeson). Vallon dies and his young son Amsterdam disappears, only to return a man (Leonardo DiCaprio) torn between a thirst for revenge and a fascination for the charismatic Cutting, with Cameron Diaz as Jenny Everdeane, the pickpocket they both love(n)

programme.title: Stargate

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
programme.desc: Waking from a coma, a female contract killer wreaks revenge on the assassins who tried to kill her(n)

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 2
programme.desc: Quentin Tarantino's stylish, violent samurai sequel in which the vengeful assassin, The Bride, concludes her ruthless quest for revenge. Before she can get to her ultimate nemesis and former mentor, however, two more of the Deadly Viper Assassination Squad stand in the way(n)

programme.title: Step Up 2: The Streets
programme.desc: Director: Jon M. Chu. Romantic sparks occur between two dance students from different backgrounds at the Maryland School of the Arts(n)

programme.title: Machine Gun Preacher
programme.desc: A former biker and drug dealer single-handedly takes on the nefarious Lord's Resistance Army in a noble bid to save young Sudanese refugees from a life of violence and suffering. Inspired by actual events, Marc Forster's Machine Gun Preacher stars Gerard Butler as Sam Childers, a tough-as-nails biker whose heart shatters upon witnessing the harrowing plight of children in Sudan. Determined that no child shall be enslaved by the brutal Lord's Resistance Army, Childers turns to God for inspiration, and establishes an orphanage for wounded kids and child soldiers. When the Lord's Resistance Army refuses to stand down, Childers organizes a militia to protect the children. In helping to give the orphans of war-torn Sudan a better future, the former outlaw begins to find new meaning in his own life as well(n)

programme.title: The Natural
programme.desc: An unknown middle-aged batter named Roy Hobbs with a mysterious past appears out of nowhere to take a losing 1920s baseball team to the top of the league in this magical sports fantasy. With the aid of a bat cut from a lightning struck tree, Hobbs lives the fame he should have had earlier when, as a rising pitcher, he is inexplicably shot by a young woman(n)

programme.desc: Nothing can snap a cynical philosophy professor out of a mental funk, except for a young student whose presence offers a breath of fresh air in his otherwise unfulfilling existence(n)

programme.desc: This film is very loosely based on novelist Daniel Defoe's story of Robinson Crusoe. In this version, Crusoe is an insensitive slave trader in the 19th century, shipwrecked on an island with many black natives. Over the course of his stay, Crusoe learns from them, rather than the other way around(n)

programme.desc: Suspenseful action thriller about a policeman who must track down a past nemesis - a psychopath known as The Terror - when he escapes from a mental institution(n)

programme.title: American Me
programme.desc: An epic and compelling drama from actor/director Edward James Olmos. The film follows three generations of a Hispanic American family, from the 1943 Pachuco Los Angelean riots to the turmoil of the mid-1970s. Olmos himself plays Santana, a crime lord who rules over the LA underworld from within his cell in Folsom State Prison, Sacramento. The film charts the rise of the so-called Mexican Mafia in a brutal and disturbing fashion, but retains the message that gang warfare, for whatever reason, can never be justified(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine lieutenant's body falls from the sky and the team links the man's death to the disappearance of a Navy chaplain thought to have been kidnapped by rebels working with Colombian crime cartels. Ziva and Tony are dispatched to conduct a rescue operation and enlist the help of former Interpol agent Monique Lisson, while Gibbs discovers there was more to the chaplain's outreach mission than meets the eye. Crime drama, guest starring Karina Lombard (The L Word) and Jamie Lee Curtis (A Fish Called Wanda).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A fire crew discovers a man's body after putting out a raging blaze at a warehouse belonging to a Navy-contracted electronics company, and Gibbs recognises the victim as Carter Plimpton - a former member of an NCIS black-ops unit. Meanwhile, a member of the Baltimore police department helping with the case appears to have a grudge against Tony.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team's mission to track the arsonist targeting US Navy facilities appears to end in success when the man in question is killed by a thermite explosion on board the USS Brewer. Meanwhile, Abby studies evidence relating to fire-starter Bruce Johnson, who died when his car exploded, and discovers coded messages in his quarters that indicate he may have been working as part of a larger gang. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The investigators discover probationary agent Ned Dorneget has been bugged by Harper Dearing, the man behind a spate of arson attacks on US Navy vessels. programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Cho is forced to revisit old haunts and confront his murky past as he investigates the fatal shooting of a reformed criminal who used to belong to the same gang as him. programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A talented chef is poisoned during a culinary competition at an exclusive restaurant. After quizzing the other contestants, Jane discovers one of them encouraged the victim, a recovering alcoholic, to relapse in a bid to sabotage his chances, and learns he was in debt to a loan shark. However, it later emerges that a jealous partner could be to blame. Crime drama, guest starring Dina Meyer.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A scientist contacts Jane for help after being exposed to a deadly virus, leaving her with only a short time to live. He rushes to the facility where she works and compiles a list of possible suspects, including her husband - but later discovers the security systems have been tampered with, letting anyone enter the lab. It then emerges that a flask containing the toxin has been emptied in the staff room, threatening the entire team. Crime drama, guest starring Tony Curran (This Life).(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The discovery of a dead English tutor leads the team to uncover a plot to steal a priceless artefact from the British Museum, but the case is complicated by the appearance of a rogue police inspector from Scotland Yard. Crime drama, starring Robin Tunney and Aunjanue Ellis.(n)

programme.desc: A woman with amnesia is found stumbling out of a Native American reservation with severe head injuries, leading the agents to discover three dead bodies. Elsewhere, Hightower gives Rigsby and Van Pelt an ultimatum. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares a well-deserved breakfast for the kids and cowboys.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Jun Tanaka and Galton Blackiston head to the fishing village of Clovelly in Devon, and pay a visit to the nearby Blackberry Farm to meet Lizzi Kirby and her prize-winning cattle. The chefs then set up their kitchen to prepare a seafood picnic for Clovelly's Lobster and Crab Feast, where they have to impress four local food judges.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Jun Tanaka and Galton Blackiston reach the end of the culinary road trip in Oxfordshire and face their final challenge: to make six small decorated cakes for the Henley Show. They also visit Tamsin Borlase, whose small organic farm supplies local restaurants.(n)

programme.title: Kids Baking Championship
programme.desc: For their first challenge, Valerie Bertinelli and Duff Goldman ask the ten of the best young bakers in the country to elevate classic pies to an art form.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: The baker and celebrity chef travels to cities around the world to visit local bakeries and the bakers who work there.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to produce home-grown summer salads in even the most confined garden plot. He also offers advice on the basic principles of dressings, and shows how simple green leaves can form the basis of a roasted peach and bresaola salad with feta and yoghurt.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef uses home-grown produce from his Essex garden to create interesting variations for pizza toppings, including a calzone and a quattro gusti cooked in his traditional wood oven for an authentic rustic taste.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a British-themed pub in St Louis that serves grilled cheese, and a brewing station in Kill Devil Hills that serves shrimp, grits and craft-made beer.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a Mexican restaurant in Chesterfield that serves pork chilli verde, and a lobster shack in Boston that makes lobster macaroni cheese.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver seeks the authentic tastes of Spain in Andalucia. He makes paella for the whole town of Ronda, birthplace of modern bullfighting, and is taught how to cut serrano ham by an award-winning father and son team. As he joins in the local festivities, including carrying a giant statue of the Virgin Mary from church to church, he takes time to cook tomato salad with chorizo, pork chops with Spanish beans, and quail's egg with black pudding.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel makes peace between the warring family who run the New York restaurant Agnello's Pizzeria.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The team helps the owner of an Italian bistro who is concerned that his manager is acting inappropriately with the staff, picking favourites based on appearance.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: A team helps restaurant owners who suspect their employees are not doing their jobs correctly, here probing a chef with a bad attitude.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.sub-title: The Return of the Speckled Band.
programme.desc: Victor and Margaret prepare for a holiday in Athens - but their preparations are delayed by an unhelpful electricity board representative, as well as an escaped snake. Starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie, with a guest appearance by Clive Mantle.(n)

programme.title: Bob Monkhouse: Million Joke Man
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady presents the definitive look at the life and career of Bob Monkhouse, starting with the trials and triumphs of his early years as a cartoonist and writer and his working partnership with Denis Goodwin.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del's latest foolproof scheme to make a million involves a spot of salmon-poaching, but the wheeler-dealer finds the bracing country air is not all it's cracked up to be. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del falls for a glamorous antiques dealer who comes to view an old cabinet described as a `Queen Anne' original - but the feeling is not necessarily mutual. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: May the Force Be with You.
programme.desc: Rodney unwittingly causes uproar in the Trotter household by bringing home a stranger claiming to be an old friend of Del's. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst, with a guest appearance by Jim Broadbent.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tires of his role as junior partner in Trotters Independent Traders and decides to set up a rival business with best mate and would-be wide boy Mickey Pearce, hoping to give wheeler-dealer Del a run for his money. Nicholas Lyndhurst, David Jason and Patrick Murray star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tries to help a drunken woman on the street, but his good deed backfires. Fearful of a life behind bars, he promptly goes into hiding - unaware devious brother Del has set him up as a joke. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney aspires to be a pop star, taking on the role of the drumless drummer in Mental Mickey's band but, not surprisingly, Del-Boy manages to ruin his chances. With a guest appearance by DJ Mike Read, alongside David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The Trotters agree to dog-sit while Boycie and Marlene go on holiday, and happily tuck into the fresh meat lovingly provided for their charge, scarcely suspecting what lies ahead. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del pays a stripper to attend a party at the Nag's Head with Rodney, who has been bet by Mickey Pearce that he cannot find a date for the occasion. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del snatches a chance to make a quick profit, leaving gullible Denzil stripped of his redundancy money. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The Trotters embark on a decorating venture for Denzil. When they find a canary lying dead in its cage, they race to replace it before the deal is ruined. Comedy, with David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney's Christmas celebrations are disrupted by the unexpected arrival of their estranged father - leaving the brothers doubtful they can trust him after such a long absence. Another chance to see the 1983 festive special of John Sullivan's comedy.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Comedy featuring a British Pakistani family, set in Sparkhill, Birmingham. Plans for daughter Shazia's forthcoming wedding to Amjad are thrown into disarray when Mr Khan forgets to book a venue, much to his wife's displeasure. The self-opinionated patriarch isn't too concerned though, he's confident that he can persuade mosque manager Dave to do him a favour - but his long-suffering nearest and dearest know from experience that nothing is ever straightforward when father's involved. Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor, Maya Sondhi and Bhavna Limbachia star, with Kris Marshall and Abdullah Afzal.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mrs Khan's mother comes to stay, jeopardising Mr Khan's big opportunity to hob-nob with the bigwigs of Sparkhill Business Association when he has to take the old woman on a shopping trip. Comedy about the trials and tribulations of a British Pakistani family, starring Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor, Maya Sondhi and Bhavna Limbachia.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mrs Khan fancies a holiday, but Mr Khan refuses to dip into the couple's `rainy day' fund - especially when they still have daughter Shazia's honeymoon to pay for. However, a meeting at the local mosque provides an unusual solution. Comedy, starring Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor and Maya Sondhi.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: An audition gives Raquel the chance of a lifetime - and perhaps more importantly, an excuse to get out of Nelson Mandela House. Del-Boy is as excited as she is about the prospect, but only because he sees himself as the man behind her rapid rise to stardom. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney aspires to be a pop star, taking on the role of the drumless drummer in Mental Mickey's band but, not surprisingly, Del-Boy manages to ruin his chances. With a guest appearance by DJ Mike Read, alongside David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The Trotters agree to dog-sit while Boycie and Marlene go on holiday, and happily tuck into the fresh meat lovingly provided for their charge, scarcely suspecting what lies ahead. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del snatches a chance to make a quick profit, leaving gullible Denzil stripped of his redundancy money. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mr Khan meddles in the local mosque's attempts to find a new call to prayer, becoming the Simon Cowell of Sparkhill with his own X Factor-style auditions. Family duty also calls when he is asked to sort out his future son-in-law Amjad's promotion. Sitcom, starring Adil Ray and Shobu Kapoor.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mr Khan's new plasma TV gives him the perfect opportunity to invite his friends round to enjoy the Pakistan versus England cricket match. The only problem is, Mrs Khan plans to host a prayer meeting for her recently widowed friend, and needs complete calm in the house. Sitcom, starring Adil Ray and Shobu Kapoor.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: The family has a spare invitation for the wedding, so Mrs Khan suggests giving it to the Parvez family. But her husband thinks the fewer guests the better and would rather have the influential Councillor Javed at the celebration. The decision is not an easy one to make - and to complicate matters, today just happens to be his own anniversary. Sitcom, starring Adil Ray and Shobu Kapoor.(n)

programme.title: I'm Alan Partridge
programme.desc: Alan's plan to watch all the James Bond films over the Bank Holiday weekend with Michael fall apart when his pal deserts him for the local American Truckfest - forcing him to decide whether to make a new friend or accompany Lynn to visit her mother's grave. Starring Steve Coogan and Felicity Montagu.(n)

programme.title: I'm Alan Partridge
programme.sub-title: I Know What Alan Did Last Summer.
programme.desc: Alan fears a visit from the Inland Revenue may be imminent, while Sonja discovers he has lied about his close ties with rock star Bono. Steve Coogan and Amelia Bullmore star.(n)

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: Nicola tries desperately to find a sports star to front the department's latest campaign. With Malcolm on holiday, she has to rely on advice from the prime minister's new fixer Steve Fleming - but cannot help feeling that he could not possibly be as nice as he seems. Political comedy, starring Rebecca Front and Peter Capaldi.(n)

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: With the election looming and the opposition planning to take office, all the gossip says Malcolm is running out of options. However, an offer of help from an unlikely source prompts him to set his finest trap to date - making it clear he is not finished yet. Political comedy, starring Rebecca Front and Peter Capaldi, with David Haig.(n)

programme.title: Limmy's Show
programme.desc: The silver-haired delinquent Mr Mulvaney plots to avoid arrest. Zoned-out waster Dee Dee brings his kitchen to life, a former classmate of Limmy suffers when the supercomputer wreaks havoc, and the town gets a peeping Tom.(n)

programme.title: Limmy's Show
programme.desc: Former drug addict Jacqueline McCafferty wants a family portrait for her living room, primary school power-broker Wee Gary offers solutions to embarrassing problems at a price, and urban menace John Paul chases his next victim to the toilet.(n)

programme.title: The Armando Iannucci Shows
programme.desc: Comedy sketch series, featuring children trying to sell a couple a huge three-bedroom house made of paper and an old man talking about the days when the Internet was in black and white. Plus, why Millwall supporters find beer too gassy and Elvis impersonators are struggling to find work.(n)

programme.title: The Interviews
programme.desc: Profile of Frankie Howerd, using archive interviews he gave to various TV chat show hosts during the 1970s and 1980s. Howerd is best remembered for the monologues he performed on stage and in sitcoms such as Up Pompeii. Narrated by Tamsin Greig.(n)

programme.title: Bob Monkhouse: Million Joke Man
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady presents the definitive look at the life and career of Bob Monkhouse, starting with the trials and triumphs of his early years as a cartoonist and writer and his working partnership with Denis Goodwin.(n)

programme.desc: The inmates decide on a wager as the parole board gathers, with Blanco odds-on favourite for release. However, the old lag turns down his freedom and leaves Fletcher in danger of losing a small fortune. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

programme.desc: A month after asking Dobby to move in with him, Mark is still waiting for Jeremy to leave and is becoming increasingly jealous of his girlfriend's visits to the permanently ill Gerrard. programme.title: Floyd's American Pie
programme.desc: The chef travels to Austin, Texas, where he visits the ranch of Larry and Shelly Beard to cook a steak with hot sauce and makes the perfect margarita. He also goes to the Big Wheel restaurant, where breakfast is prepared for truckers, and cooks chicken fajitas.(n)

programme.title: Floyd's American Pie
programme.desc: The chef visits the Sonoma Valley and San Francisco in California, for a rendezvous at Alioto's Restaurant in the fisherman's wharf to cook a Sicilian dish and meet owner Nuncio Alioto. He heads on to the Ironhouse vineyard for a display of local produce, and serves up a meal for one of the owners, Forrect Tancer, before dropping into Chinatown for a guided tour with Shirley Fong-Torres.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Food
programme.desc: Keith Floyd is off to Cornwall to visit a field kitchen at HMS Raleigh, the new-entry training establishment for all ratings joining the Royal Navy.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Food
programme.desc: Keith Floyd prepares chicken with peppers and cream for the crew of a French trawler in Newlyn, Cornwall, and rustles up pork Normande for the owner of a pig farm. The chef also meets the man in charge of the Cornish Smoked Fish Co in Chatlestown.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Food
programme.desc: Chef Keith Floyd visits Enzo Mauro at his restaurant in Newbridge, Penzance, where he also talks to Nick Howells about salted pilchards. programme.title: Battlechefs
programme.desc: The celebrity cooks continue travelling across the Mediterranean, reaching the half-way point of the contest. As usual, they take it in turns to command the kitchen - and the attentions of arbiter Marco Pierre White.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins usher the nine remaining home-bakers back into the tent for the fourth week of the contest. This time, the competitors must tackle desserts, beginning with a signature challenge in the form of a French classic - creme brulees. With the clock ticking, the contestants must grill their offerings to perfection to avoid serving up an unappetising scrambled egg and custard soup. Next up is the technical challenge, in which Mary Berry asks the group to prepare Spanische Windtorte, an Austrian meringue inspired by the tastes of Spain, Switzerland and France. Finally, the showstopper this week involves baking a three-tiered cheesecake stack, and only the most structurally sound creations will be worthy of securing their maker the title of star baker.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Two semi-finalists work a shift in Pierre Koffmann's restaurant at the Berkeley hotel in Knightsbridge, central London, before the chef asks them to prepare one of his signature dishes - a confit of salmon with sauteed Bayonne ham and a piperade of tomatoes and green peppers. They then face a final test in which they must use what they have learned from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Marcus Wareing and Monica Galetti, who pick one of them to go through to the last round of the contest.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Everyday Gourmets
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers demonstrate how to create a restaurant-quality meal on the tightest of budgets. They pick up some insider tips from Michelin-starred chef David Everitt-Matthias, are inspired by the work of celebrated 19th-century cook Alexis Soyer, and put everything they've learnt into practice when they help three girls say thank you to two people who are very important to them.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef's gastronomic road trip from Venice to Istanbul through the countries of the former Byzantine Empire is nearing its end as he leaves southern Greece for the shores of western Turkey. On the Cesme Peninsula Rick enjoys creamy Armola cheese matured in goat skins, Urla's famous red wine and the ultimate Turkish breakfast. He also cooks the country's iconic dish sultan's delight - a mouth-watering lamb stew on a bed of aubergine puree.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Chef Tom Kerridge takes over as host from Michel Roux Jr on the culinary show, and is joined on the first edition by Si King and Dave Myers. Tom challenges the Hairy Bikers to come up with a speedy meal to rival his quick sausage and bean casserole, while drinks expert Joe Wadsack surprises them all with his choice of wine to match the food. Plus, Fast Show star Arabella Weir goes behind the scenes at one of London's most upmarket hotels to discover the secret to making the perfect sandwich.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: The return of the show featuring recipes, tips and discussions on the latest food trends, beginning with a look at how to reduce food waste and save money. Host Michel Roux Jr and resident drinks expert Kate Goodman are joined by The Great British Bake Off judge Mary Berry, who uses stale bread to create a fish-pie topping and shares stories of her days as freezer correspondent in the 1960s. Kate takes part in a tasting of grappa - which is made from a by-product of wine-making - and there is debate about whether food is too cheap.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins usher the nine remaining home-bakers back into the tent for the fourth week of the contest. This time, the competitors must tackle desserts, beginning with a signature challenge in the form of a French classic - creme brulees. With the clock ticking, the contestants must grill their offerings to perfection to avoid serving up an unappetising scrambled egg and custard soup. Next up is the technical challenge, in which Mary Berry asks the group to prepare Spanische Windtorte, an Austrian meringue inspired by the tastes of Spain, Switzerland and France. Finally, the showstopper this week involves baking a three-tiered cheesecake stack, and only the most structurally sound creations will be worthy of securing their maker the title of star baker.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Two semi-finalists work a shift in Pierre Koffmann's restaurant at the Berkeley hotel in Knightsbridge, central London, before the chef asks them to prepare one of his signature dishes - a confit of salmon with sauteed Bayonne ham and a piperade of tomatoes and green peppers. They then face a final test in which they must use what they have learned from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Marcus Wareing and Monica Galetti, who pick one of them to go through to the last round of the contest.(n)

programme.title: World's Best Restaurants
programme.desc: A multisensory gastronomic adventure in Ibiza, an art deco classic in New York and an upmarket steakhouse in Los Cabos, Mexico.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef's gastronomic road trip from Venice to Istanbul through the countries of the former Byzantine Empire is nearing its end as he leaves southern Greece for the shores of western Turkey. On the Cesme Peninsula Rick enjoys creamy Armola cheese matured in goat skins, Urla's famous red wine and the ultimate Turkish breakfast. He also cooks the country's iconic dish sultan's delight - a mouth-watering lamb stew on a bed of aubergine puree.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Chef Tom Kerridge takes over as host from Michel Roux Jr on the culinary show, and is joined on the first edition by Si King and Dave Myers. Tom challenges the Hairy Bikers to come up with a speedy meal to rival his quick sausage and bean casserole, while drinks expert Joe Wadsack surprises them all with his choice of wine to match the food. Plus, Fast Show star Arabella Weir goes behind the scenes at one of London's most upmarket hotels to discover the secret to making the perfect sandwich.(n)

It's the only way the government can prevent the pollution that he caused escaping to the outside world and creating a race of six-eyed squirrels. Warning: contains full frontal male nudity(n)
