programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: Rell (Jordan Peele) becomes attached to an adorable kitten named Keanu while dealing with a painful breakup. But when he returns home one night with his cousin Clarence (Keegan-Michael Key), he is devastated to learn that his house has been burglarized and his feline friend is missing. The nerdy duo attempt to find the culprits who took Keanu, and they eventually get in way over their heads as their search leads them to infiltrate a violent street gang. Peter Atencio directed this irreverent action comedy, which co-stars Method Man, Luis Guzman, Will Forte, and Nia Long(n)

programme.title: Assassins
programme.desc: Sylvester Stallone stars as a seasoned hitman who has to face off against a younger, better looking rival in Antonio Banderas in Richard Donner's quick-fire action(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while in the act of divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once more send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but the shock of coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower(n)

programme.title: The Family Man
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage is the slick financier who usually wakes up to a blonde and the Wall St Journal. But not today, because angel Don Cheadle gives him a glimpse of what might have been, with kids, a wife and a job selling tires(n)

programme.title: Batman Returns
programme.desc: Superhero Batman resurfaces for another Gotham City adventure, pitted against the villainous Penguin and the devious, sexually-charged Catwoman. Action(n)

programme.title: Mariela Castro's March: Cuba's LGBT Revolution
programme.desc: A profile of Mariela Castro, a daughter of Cuban president Raúl Castro and a member of the National Assembly who is an influential advocate for the nation's LGBT community(n)

programme.title: Unbreakable
programme.desc: Actor Bruce Willis and writer/director M. Night Shyamalan reunite after the surprise success of The Sixth Sense for this supernatural thriller. David Dunne (Willis) is taking a train from New York City back home to Philadelphia after a job interview that didn't go well when his car jumps the tracks and collides with an oncoming engine, with David the only survivor among the 131 passengers on board. Astoundingly, David is not only alive, he hardly seems to have been touched. As David wonders what has happened to him and why he was able to walk away, he encounters a mysterious stranger, Elijah Prince (Samuel L. Jackson), who explains to David that there are a certain number of people who are "unbreakable" -- they have remarkable endurance and courage, a predisposition toward dangerous behavior, and feel invincible but also have strange premonitions of terrible events. Is David "unbreakable"? And if he is, what are the physical and psychological ramifications of this knowledge? Unbreakable also stars Robin Wright-Penn as Audrey, David's wife; the supporting cast includes Spencer Treat Clark and Joey Perillo(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Two years after saving the world with the Autobots, Sam Witwicky is heading off to university when an ancient Decepticon named The Fallen returns to Earth seeking revenge. Their home planet of Cybertron rendered uninhabitable, the Autobots begin working with the military to hunt down any remaining Decepticons. Meanwhile, Sam and Mikaela race to unlock the secret history of the Transformers on Earth in order to save the planet from the most-formidable Decepticon to date(n)

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War
programme.desc: This exhilarating spin-off of "Snow White and the Huntsman" acts as both prequel and sequel to the original film, detailing the adventures of Eric the Huntsman as he gets caught up in the rivalry between wicked queens Ravenna and Freya. During his quest, Eric is also endangered by his feelings for fellow warrior Sara, since ice queen Freya has decreed that love is forbidden in her kingdom(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: America's favourite family make their debut on the big screen in David Silverman's comedy. When Homer rescues a pig from certain death, little does he realise the full consequences of his action: Springfield will be isolated from the world by a gargantuan glass dome. It's the only way the government can prevent the pollution that he caused escaping to the outside world and creating a race of six-eyed squirrels. The townsfolk, armed with torches and pitchforks, are soon after him, and the family have to flee to Alaska. But even Homer knows he must return to do the right thing... Warning: contains full frontal male nudity(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: Rell (Jordan Peele) becomes attached to an adorable kitten named Keanu while dealing with a painful breakup. But when he returns home one night with his cousin Clarence (Keegan-Michael Key), he is devastated to learn that his house has been burglarized and his feline friend is missing. The nerdy duo attempt to find the culprits who took Keanu, and they eventually get in way over their heads as their search leads them to infiltrate a violent street gang. Peter Atencio directed this irreverent action comedy, which co-stars Method Man, Luis Guzman, Will Forte, and Nia Long(n)

programme.title: Assassins
programme.desc: Sylvester Stallone stars as a seasoned hitman who has to face off against a younger, better looking rival in Antonio Banderas in Richard Donner's quick-fire action(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while in the act of divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once more send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but the shock of coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower(n)

programme.title: The Family Man
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage is the slick financier who usually wakes up to a blonde and the Wall St Journal. But not today, because angel Don Cheadle gives him a glimpse of what might have been, with kids, a wife and a job selling tires(n)

programme.title: Batman Returns
programme.desc: Superhero Batman resurfaces for another Gotham City adventure, pitted against the villainous Penguin and the devious, sexually-charged Catwoman. Action(n)

programme.title: Mariela Castro's March: Cuba's LGBT Revolution
programme.desc: A profile of Mariela Castro, a daughter of Cuban president Raúl Castro and a member of the National Assembly who is an influential advocate for the nation's LGBT community(n)

programme.title: Unbreakable
programme.desc: Actor Bruce Willis and writer/director M. Night Shyamalan reunite after the surprise success of The Sixth Sense for this supernatural thriller. David Dunne (Willis) is taking a train from New York City back home to Philadelphia after a job interview that didn't go well when his car jumps the tracks and collides with an oncoming engine, with David the only survivor among the 131 passengers on board. Astoundingly, David is not only alive, he hardly seems to have been touched. As David wonders what has happened to him and why he was able to walk away, he encounters a mysterious stranger, Elijah Prince (Samuel L. Jackson), who explains to David that there are a certain number of people who are "unbreakable" -- they have remarkable endurance and courage, a predisposition toward dangerous behavior, and feel invincible but also have strange premonitions of terrible events. Is David "unbreakable"? And if he is, what are the physical and psychological ramifications of this knowledge? Unbreakable also stars Robin Wright-Penn as Audrey, David's wife; the supporting cast includes Spencer Treat Clark and Joey Perillo(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Two years after saving the world with the Autobots, Sam Witwicky is heading off to university when an ancient Decepticon named The Fallen returns to Earth seeking revenge. Their home planet of Cybertron rendered uninhabitable, the Autobots begin working with the military to hunt down any remaining Decepticons. Meanwhile, Sam and Mikaela race to unlock the secret history of the Transformers on Earth in order to save the planet from the most-formidable Decepticon to date(n)

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War
programme.desc: This exhilarating spin-off of "Snow White and the Huntsman" acts as both prequel and sequel to the original film, detailing the adventures of Eric the Huntsman as he gets caught up in the rivalry between wicked queens Ravenna and Freya. During his quest, Eric is also endangered by his feelings for fellow warrior Sara, since ice queen Freya has decreed that love is forbidden in her kingdom(n)

programme.title: The Color of Money
programme.desc: Paul Newman returns to his role in The Hustler as an ageing liquor salesman inspired by a talented youngster to take up the pool cue after a 25-year break. With the aid of the young man's girlfriend, he encourages his new-found apprentice to learn the hustler's art in backwater pool halls. It isn't long before both headstrong protege and mentor are gunning for the same big bucks(n)

programme.title: The Cider House Rules
programme.desc: John Irving's adaptation of his own novel won him an Oscar for Lasse Hallstrom's drama starring Tobey Maguire and Michael Caine (who also picked up a statue). Maguire is an orphan, mentored by Caine who runs the orphanage he grew up in but Maguire balks at Caine's side-line in illegal abortions. And after young couple Candy and Wally come to Larch for a termination, Homer returns home with them. After Wally is posted overseas on war duty, Homer and Candy become closer at the cider house where they work; but news of a fellow worker's pregnancy leads Homer to re-examine his principles(n)

programme.title: Joe Kidd
programme.desc: Tracker Joe Kidd is hired by vengeful rancher Harlan to lead his hunters to a Mexican bandit. But when Kidd sees Harlan's viciousness in action, he switches sides. Western famous for the scene in which Clint drives a train through a town(n)

programme.desc: Upbeat musical spin on John Waters' 1988 cult hit about a plump, socially conscious teenage girl who shakes up things on a TV dance show in 1962 Baltimore(n)

programme.title: If You're Not in the Obit, Eat Breakfast
programme.desc: Carl Reiner seeks out some of his nonagenarian friends, including Norman Lear, Mel Brooks, Betty White, Dick Van Dyke, Stan Lee and Iris Apfel—and even a few centenarian ones—to discuss the secrets of their longevity and still-active lifestyles. Tony Bennett performs the film's opening title song, "The Best Is Yet to Come."(n)

programme.title: Catch Me if You Can
programme.desc: Golden Globe winner Leonardo DiCaprio stars as conman Frank Abagnale, who poses as an airline pilot, a doctor, and an assistant attorney general in order to cash millions of dollars in fraudulent cheques. Based on true events and directed by Acadamy Award winner Steven Spielberg, Catch Me If You Can follows an entertaining game of cat and mouse between Abagnale and FBI Agent Carl Hanratty (Tom Hanks) as he pursues the conman(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Boss'
programme.desc: A look at "The Boss," a 2016 comedy about a successful businesswoman jailed for insider trading who seeks redemption upon her release. The film stars Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage, and is directed by Ben Falcone(n)

programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbour troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door just as they're about to sell their house. During their feud with the ladies, the couple team up with ex-fratboy Teddy, who tormented them the last time around(n)

programme.desc: Working as a janitor, maths genius Will Hunting is struggling to find direction in his life, until a dedicated psychologist helps him come to terms with his gift. Drama(n)

programme.desc: An investment banker copes with his wife's sudden death by dismantling the machines surrounding him. Meanwhile, his complaints to a vending-machine company spark an unexpected relationship with a customer-service rep(n)

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: Milla Jovovich leads a team of commandos into the multi-national Umbrella Corporation's locked-down bunker, which is controlled by the main computer, The Red Queen. The unit is sealed because of a virus that gassed all the staff but, as Jovovich and her team discover, the virus has re-animated them. Now, as well as facing the computer's weaponry, they must tackle the living dead to prevent the virus escaping into the outside world. Paul W Anderson's horror thriller is based on the successful computer game(n)

programme.title: Chris Gethard: Career Suicide
programme.desc: Comedian Chris Gethard performs his off-Broadway show at the Tribeca Performing Arts Center, where he candidly shares his experiences with depression, mental illness and addiction but swears he's found hope in the strangest places(n)

programme.title: Blues Brothers 2000
programme.desc: After their first adventure, Elwood was given a prison sentence of 18 years. Upon release he learns that his former partner Jake has died. Determined to get the band back together, he picks up 10-year-old Buster and Mack McTeer. They travel across the country to Louisiana for a battle of the bands(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: In this comic-book adventure set in the 1980s, the X-Men are forced to confront an ancient mutant called Apocalypse. After the resurrected villain recruits four superpowered followers, Professor X and his charges attempt to stop them(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: 06-11-2017. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bees
programme.desc: Gina Prince-Bythewood's adaptation of Sue Monk Kidd's novel The Secret Life of Bees stars Dakota Fanning as Lily, a 14-year-old growing up in a small Southern town in 1964. She is haunted by memories of shooting her mother when she was a young girl. Lily lives with her emotionally distant father, and her best friend is their African-American housekeeper Rosaleen (Jennifer Hudson). After locals beat Rosaleen for attempting to register as a voter, and Lily's dad goes one step too far during an argument with his daughter, Lily and Rosaleen set out to find the place where the only picture Lily has of her mother was taken. That place turns out to be the home of the independent Boatwright sisters, a trio -- Queen Latifah, Sophie Okonedo, and Alicia Keys -- who make a very successful living producing honey. Lily and her friend move in with them, and soon the girl learns about both beekeeping and life(n)

programme.title: Evil Dead 2: Dead by Dawn
programme.desc: Something's out there. It lives in the woods. In the dark. In the night. Something that's come back from the dead". The film tells the story of a battle with the supernatural of man vs demon, and as Bruce Campbell who reprises his starring role from the original"Evil Dead" says, "It's the story of a decent guy in a sticky situation(n)

programme.title: Friday
programme.desc: A typical day in the life of Craig, an alright guy with some crazy friends. Like Smokey, who has 24 hours to pay back Deebo, South Central's nastiest thug - or else. Trouble is, neither Craig's mother nor his main squeeze have the cash. As time ticks away, the chance this pair will ever see Saturday is fading fast(n)

programme.title: The Visit
programme.desc: The Visit is a comedic horror film from director M. Night Shyamalan that follows a pair of children whose lives are changed drastically when their mother (Kathryn Hahn) takes them to visit their grandparents. After seeing their grandparents engaged in activities that they had been kept as a secret to the entire family previously, they are endangered and rendered potentially unable to ever return to their previous existence. The movie co-stars Peter McRobbie and Deanna Dunagan, with music from Hans Zimmer(n)

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: Roland Emmerich returns to the helm for this long-awaited sequel to the 1996 blockbuster Independence Day. Fearful of another attack, the nations of Earth have teamed up against their common enemy -- the extraterrestrials who brought humanity to the brink of extinction. Using recovered alien technology to bolster their defenses, the alliance braces itself for another invasion. Jeff Goldblum and Bill Pullman reprise their roles from the original film, while Liam Hemsworth, Jessie Usher, and Maika Monroe are among the new additions to the cast(n)

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: Hilarious follow up to Friday. Now it's Next Friday and Craig is still living with his parents in South Central Los Angeles while looking for a job and remembering his moment of glory four years earlier, when he finally beat local bully, Debo . But now Debo has escaped from prison and is looking to exact revenge on Craig. Craig's dad takes him to Rancho Cucamonga to hide out with his Uncle Elroy and cousin Day-Day, who have moved to the suburbs after winning the lottery. But once he gets there, Craig and his cousin have a string of suburban adventures that make his South Central experiences look tame(n)

programme.desc: 06-11-2017. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bees
programme.desc: Gina Prince-Bythewood's adaptation of Sue Monk Kidd's novel The Secret Life of Bees stars Dakota Fanning as Lily, a 14-year-old growing up in a small Southern town in 1964. She is haunted by memories of shooting her mother when she was a young girl. Lily lives with her emotionally distant father, and her best friend is their African-American housekeeper Rosaleen (Jennifer Hudson). After locals beat Rosaleen for attempting to register as a voter, and Lily's dad goes one step too far during an argument with his daughter, Lily and Rosaleen set out to find the place where the only picture Lily has of her mother was taken. That place turns out to be the home of the independent Boatwright sisters, a trio -- Queen Latifah, Sophie Okonedo, and Alicia Keys -- who make a very successful living producing honey. Lily and her friend move in with them, and soon the girl learns about both beekeeping and life(n)

programme.title: Evil Dead 2: Dead by Dawn
programme.desc: Something's out there. It lives in the woods. In the dark. In the night. Something that's come back from the dead". programme.title: Friday
programme.desc: A typical day in the life of Craig, an alright guy with some crazy friends. Like Smokey, who has 24 hours to pay back Deebo, South Central's nastiest thug - or else. Trouble is, neither Craig's mother nor his main squeeze have the cash. As time ticks away, the chance this pair will ever see Saturday is fading fast(n)

programme.title: The Visit
programme.desc: The Visit is a comedic horror film from director M. Night Shyamalan that follows a pair of children whose lives are changed drastically when their mother (Kathryn Hahn) takes them to visit their grandparents. After seeing their grandparents engaged in activities that they had been kept as a secret to the entire family previously, they are endangered and rendered potentially unable to ever return to their previous existence. The movie co-stars Peter McRobbie and Deanna Dunagan, with music from Hans Zimmer(n)

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: Roland Emmerich returns to the helm for this long-awaited sequel to the 1996 blockbuster Independence Day. Fearful of another attack, the nations of Earth have teamed up against their common enemy -- the extraterrestrials who brought humanity to the brink of extinction. Using recovered alien technology to bolster their defenses, the alliance braces itself for another invasion. Jeff Goldblum and Bill Pullman reprise their roles from the original film, while Liam Hemsworth, Jessie Usher, and Maika Monroe are among the new additions to the cast(n)

But when he arrives he realizes she and her new boyfriend have just checked in. Mila Kunis, Russell Brand, Bill Hader(n)

programme.title: Dim Sum Funeral
programme.desc: Death brings a contentious family together (though that doesn't mean they get along) in this comedy-drama from director Anna Chi. When elderly Mrs. Xiao (Lisa Lu) dies in her sleep at home, her housekeeper and close friend Viola (Talia Shire) contacts her four adult children in hopes they'll come home to help with the funeral. Unfortunately, Mrs. Xiao didn't have many friends besides Viola, her children all have issues with her, and given her zeal to assimilate into American culture, the siblings are more than puzzled that she insisted upon a traditional Chinese funeral lasting a full seven days. Alexander (Russell Wong), a successful doctor, is still coming to terms with his overly strict mother and philandering father, and is unexpectedly reunited with his ex-wife (Kelly Hu), who he lost through his own infidelity. Elizabeth (Julia Nickson), a writer, also crosses paths with her former spouse (Adrian Hough) while she mourns both her mother and her young son. Victoria (Francoise Yip) has never been able to forgive her mom after she rejected her for marrying an African-American. And MeiMei (Steph Song), an actress, is a lesbian who wants to have children with her significant other Deedee (Bai Ling); they've been having trouble finding a suitable sperm donor, though they think one of the monks at the funeral may be just what they're looking for. Dim Sum Funeral received its world premiere at the 2008 AFI Fest(n)

programme.desc: An advertising executive gets into a terrible auto accident and awakens to find himself in heavenly Judgment City. There he learns he must meet with a bureaucratic panel and defend his existence. If he persuades them that he lived a productive life free from unnecessary fear, then he will be admitted into Heaven. If he fails, he must go back to Earth and try again. Since the executive had been a notoriously selfish coward during his earthly existence, he definitely has his work cut out for him(n)

programme.title: Cocoon: The Return
programme.desc: Daniel Petric rises to the challenge of directing this sequel to Ron Howard's successful original. Those who chose immortality with the Antareans return with the aliens. The visitors are back to rescue a cocoon found on the ocean floor and now the subject of scientific investigation, while the immortal old folk are back to visit growing grandsons and ageing friends. Once again, Don Ameche, Jessica Tandy and Hume Cronyn - as Arthur Selwyn, Alma Finley and Joseph Finley respectively - steal the film, but new face Elaine Strich, as Ruby Steinberg, the hotel owner the others try to fix up with stay-behind Bernard Lefkowitz, is also a delight. As the two plots merge, can the Antareans rescue their friend, and will the immortals return or stay on Earth to grow old and die? Edited for content(n)

programme.title: Casper
programme.desc: Based on the popular cartoon character, this family-oriented "ghost story" is about a not-so-scary spirit who bonds with a little girl (Christina Ricci). The eternally irritable Ms. Carrigan (Cathy Moriarty) discovers that the only thing she's been left in her recently departed father's will is a rickety old house in New England. Naturally, the woman is furious about this, until her "close personal friend" and assistant, Dibbs (Eric Idle of Monty Python fame), discovers a secret message that a treasure may be concealed somewhere in the house. The two take off for Maine, only to learn that the house is haunted by Casper "the friendly ghost" and his three ghostly uncles Stinky, Stretch, and Fatso. After futilely recruiting an exorcist (Don Novello, more or less reviving his Father Guido Sarducci character from Saturday Night Live) and a "professional ghost exterminator" (Dan Aykroyd), she brings in a "ghost psychiatrist" (Bill Pullman) and his daughter Kat (Ricci). Innocently attracted to the young girl, Casper befriends Kat as they try to save the ghosts' home from the evil Carrigan. Eye-popping special effects highlight this magical story that touches (albeit lightly) on the theme of what lies at the heart of human desires. Clint Eastwood, Rodney Dangerfield, Mel Gibson and The Crypt Keeper (of Tales from the Crypt) all make cameos as apparitions in the mirror Bill Pullman looks into in the house(n)

programme.title: The Princess Diaries
programme.desc: Mia's an ordinary San Francisco schoolgirl - a slightly gawky, slightly geeky teenager who's a bit of an outsider. She feels a little bit different from the other students, but has no idea why. Then one day her grandmother makes a surprise visit, and tells Mia that her father was actually the Crown Prince of a small European country called Genovia. As he's dead, it's time for Mia to take over as Crown Princess. But does she want to leave her normal life in the States to become royalty? In the meantime, her grandmother insists on her having a makeover and deportment lessons in preparation for her royal role. This is classic Disney family entertainment: charming, amusing and highly watchable(n)

programme.title: The Last Mimzy
programme.desc: Chris O'Neil and Rhiannon Leigh Wryn star as siblings Noah and Emma Wilder in Bob Shaye's intelligent family sci-fi adventure drama that doesn't talk down to children. While staying at their family beach house near Seattle, the two find a box of things that look like toys, but prove to be far more mysterious. Sent back in time, the 'toys' are trying to pass on a message about the future. And the more Noah and Emma play with the objects from the box, the more their intelligence grows. But one day Noah lines up the toys and accidentally activates a powerful force that creates a state-wide blackout. With her family under arrest by the FBI, Emma must make sense of the messages Mimzy, the toy rabbit, has been telepathically communicating to her(n)

programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk Gets a New Shrink

Feeling personally responsible when one of his patients is charged with the murder of a cleaning lady, Monk's psychiatrist Dr. Kroger (Stanley Kamel) retires from practice. This of course sends Monk (Tony Shalhoub) into a tailspin: Not only has he been "abandoned" by Kroger, but he now must endure the tortuous process of finding another shrink. If for no other reason that to get Kroger back on the job, Monk determines to solve the murder--and in the process ends up kidnapped by a drug smuggler who didn't even know the dead woman. programme.title: Alien
programme.desc: "In space, no one can hear you scream." A close encounter of the third kind becomes a Jaws-style nightmare when an alien invades a spacecraft in Ridley Scott's sci-fi horror classic. On the way home from a mission for the Company, the Nostromo's crew is woken up from hibernation by the ship's Mother computer to answer a distress signal from a nearby planet. Capt. Dallas's (Tom Skerritt) rescue team discovers a bizarre pod field, but things get even stranger when a face-hugging creature bursts out of a pod and attaches itself to Kane (John Hurt). Over the objections of Ripley (Sigourney Weaver), science officer Ash (Ian Holm) lets Kane back on the ship. The acid-blooded incubus detaches itself from an apparently recovered Kane, but an alien erupts from Kane's stomach and escapes. The alien starts stalking the humans, pitting Dallas and his crew (and cat) against a malevolent killing machine that also has a protector in the nefarious Company(n)

programme.sub-title: Britain's Best Walks with Julia Bradbury: Fell Walk: Pen-Y-Ghent, Yorkshire.
programme.desc: At 694 metres in height, Pen-y-ghent is the smallest fell on the Yorkshire Three Peaks Challenge, but the dramatic summit affords far-reaching views above the Dales, with plenty of surprises en route. The peak lies 3km east of Horton in Ribblesdale and the Pennine Way links the summit to the village. As Julia reveals, the route is around 5km in length, as the Way curves initially to the north before turning east to reach the summit.(n)

programme.title: Live French Open Tennis
programme.desc: John Inverdale presents coverage of the men's singles final on the 15th day's play at Roland Garros, where Novak Djokovic defeated Andy Murray in last year's showpiece match. Djokovic completed a career Grand Slam with his 3-6, 6-1, 6-2, 6-4 win, becoming the first man since Rod Laver in 1969 to hold all four major titles at once and the first man in history to do so on three different surfaces. With analysis from Jim Courier, Mark Petchey and Fabrice Santoro, commentary by Nick Mullins and reports from Celina Hinchcliffe.(n)

programme.title: Vera

No sooner have they arrived, than a second body is discovered. Vera discovers the two victims met the night before their deaths, and goes in search of a connection between them. Forensics evidence reveals that one was definitely present when the other died - but when no murder weapon or motive can be found, Vera begins to suspect a third party was involved.(n)

programme.title: The Loch
programme.desc: New series. programme.title: Amazing Animal Births
programme.desc: New series. Zoologist Lucy Cooke sees first-hand the incredible bond between animals and their newborn offspring. She begins by heading to the Yorkshire Dales to join shepherdess Amanda Owen and her husband Clive, who have more than a thousand sheep that lamb on some of the toughest terrain in Britain. Lucy then visits Howletts Wild Animal Park in Kent, which is part of animal conservation charity The Aspinall Foundation, where she witnesses the birth of a black rhino - of which there are only around 2,500 of left in the wild.(n)

The This Morning host talks to David Walliams, Judi Dench and Joanna Lumley to help understand the Duke and how he embodies the award, and also chats to Prince Edward and his wife Sophie, Countess of Wessex, who give a unique glimpse of life inside the royal family and the time and work the Duke still invests in the scheme he founded.(n)

In the first of two parts, he heads for the orang-utan rehabilitation centre in Sepilok, where he discovers how the animals are being threatened by forest fires, learns about the damage that overfishing is doing to sea turtles' natural habitat, and tries to persuade a gibbon to climb a tree - a skill it needs to learn before it can return to the wild.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot

David Suchet stars, with Niamh Cusack, Abigail Cruttenden and Sean Pertwee.(n)

David Suchet, Zoe Wanamaker and Greta Scacchi star.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Jack congratulates himself on having got the better of Robert in the run-up to the risk-management inquiry, but just when everything seems to be going his way, he goes and causes a road accident . programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps first-time buyers Lucy and Joe, who have set their heart on a cottage in the Cotswolds, where they can start a family. However, Joe wants a project and has already discounted hundreds of potential homes online, so it looks like he's going to be hard to please. Phil's search is just as difficult in Bristol, where country boy Paul and city girl Elly want a home with outside space that's close to the railway station. Finding somewhere that ticks all the boxes could be tricky.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: The host helps homeowners Richard, Jackie and Robert improve their West Sussex properties in the hope that buyer Eliza will make them a lucrative offer.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: Andy Macbeth and Jo Denton, Christchurch earthquake refugees, are building a new life and a modern-day fortress against the elements in alpine Queenstown.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The first in a week of parties in Newcastle is hosted by mother and workaholic Clare, who aims to impress her guests with an Indian-themed menu of spicy pakoras and lamb curry in the hope of winning the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Comedy promoter David hosts the second night in Newcastle, where he aims to impress his guests with a fine-dining menu featuring caviar, scallops, beef fillet and oysters, in the hope of winning the £1,000 prize. However, some of the guests have reservations about the host, meaning he has his work cut out for him.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third night in Newcastle sees sophisticated marketing consultant Liz trying to impress her guests with a fancy French-themed menu. However, she spends most of her time trying to keep the peace as outspoken comedy promoter David annoys club singer John and rubs mum-of-three Clare up the wrong way with his snobbish views.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Club singer John hopes that a menu inspired by his travels around the world will help him win the £1,000 prize as he hosts the fourth night in Newcastle. He also has a musical surprise in store for his guests, but faces a challenge trying to impress David who refused to take part in the fun and games on Liz's evening. However, further rifts appear in the group when Vicky wants to discuss Geordie icons.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the night of the final dinner party in Newcastle and the turn of hotel administrator Vicky to entertain her guests. However, there is tension in the air and the spiritual host is challenged to keep the peace when John lets David know exactly what he thinks of him. The theme of negativity continues as mum-of-three Claire and Liz both take the comedy promoter to task over his questionable sense of humour, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Langsmeade House in Thame, Oxfordshire, where Dutch-born owner Marianne Abben and her housekeeper Fran Birch hope to demonstrate that their B&B offers the best value for money. The quirky pair's hosting style proves a hit with some of their guests, before others reveal their competitive side during a Charleston dance lesson.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Stratford House Guesthouse in Stratford-upon-Avon on their second outing, where couple Natasha and Dai Pollock hope to impress their peers. But things do not run smoothly, as the guests are left unimpressed with the decor and discover nasty surprises in some of the drawers.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third B&B of the week is pet-friendly Edmund House in Deal, Kent, where owner Michael Prime is joined by his mum Lorna. On arrival, Marianne Abben and Fran Birch love the seaside-inspired room, but entrepreneur Mark Genders is far from thrilled by the `no frills' experience. Over dinner, tensions run high after self-confessed trouble-maker Marianne asks Mark to reveal which of the group he would and would not employ, and Lorna gets short shrift when she puts forward her application.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Entrepreneur Mark Genders welcomes the contestants to the Five Bells Pub in Berkshire and hopes they will approve of his small but perfectly formed rooms. He organises an ale-tasting activity, although it fails to please all of his guests. Michael and Lorna admit they have seen a new side of Mark - however, will it affect their feedback?.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners settle some scores and discover how much they have been paid, before the winner is revealed. Marianne and Fran from Langsmeade House begin by explaining that their worn rug is in fact a 200-year-old antique, Natasha and Dal from Stratford House confront Michael and Lorna about their strong language and cleaning techniques, while Mark Genders compares his experience at Edmund House to flying with a low budget airline.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Construction site manager Mark hosts the first of a week of dinner parties in Kent, hoping a fun-fuelled evening will impress his guests Karen, Verush, Amrick and Anthony.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the second night in Kent, competitive sales assistant Verush is going all out to win by hosting a Czech-themed evening, but ex-stripper Mark isn't impressed, comparing Verush's pasta to MDF and pastry to leather, while the first night's argument between dog lover Karen and photographer Anthony is reignited.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dog enthusiast Karen hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Kent, hoping to impress her guests by serving up a menu inspired by her four-legged friends. After the cheesy fun of the previous night, she is determined to impress her guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Amrick takes his turn to host in Kent, hoping to wow his guests by revealing his musical talents and with his traditional Indian cuisine. But with dog-lover Karen and competitive Verush not liking hot and spicy food, there could be trouble - while photographer Anthony questions ex-stripper Mark's dress sense.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Photographer Anthony attempts to wow his guests with an evening of fine food and culinary excellence on the final day of the competition in Kent. However, the soiree is jeopardised by ex-stripper Mark on overdrive and dog-lover Karen showcasing some incredible impressions from animals to Anthony himself. The host might be cockily confident he can win, but Karen seemingly remains in pole position to bag the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: The Hi Way elephant family have been hit with a potentially deadly virus affecting animals in captivity and in the wild. With the youngest members of the family most at risk, the keepers and Chester Zoo's veterinary team do all they can to combat the mysterious illness. Meanwhile, Mac the stallion zebra is introduced to the zoo's three mares in the hope they will produce much needed offspring for this endangered species. There's also a look into the bizarre world of the naked mole rat.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Jack, Dougal and Ted head off for a summer break at a caravan park. However, they immediately get on the wrong side of their fellow holiday-makers, and matters become even more dire when Father Noel Furlong turns up - with his hapless youth group in tow. Comedy, guest starring Graham Norton.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: The priests organise a raffle to raise funds to repair their leaky roof, planning to award a car as the prize. Unfortunately, Ted accidentally wrecks it before the grand draw takes place, and embarks on a frantic search for a replacement. Dermot Morgan and Ardal O'Hanlon play the Craggy Island clerics.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Best Loved Sitcoms
programme.desc: Documentary, celebrating some of the many classic sitcoms that have entertained British audiences over the past 50 years, narrated by Tamsin Greig, herself a star of the likes of Friday Night Dinner and Black Books. Along the way, she takes in everything from modern `game-changers' such as The Office, Twenty Twelve and Peep Show, to vintage shows including The Likely Lads, Dad's Army and Steptoe and Son. Making use of a cross-generational poll, she presents a countdown that reveals which show has become the most revered sitcom of all, and a host of stars including Mrs Brown's Boys' Brendan O'Carroll, One Foot in the Grave's Richard Wilson, Blackadder's Tony Robinson and Keeping Up Appearances' Patricia Routledge share their thoughts on working on some of the nation's most treasured comedy dramas.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with Sean Lock and Henning Wehn taking on guest captain Bill Bailey and Jessica Hynes. Susie Dent is joined by Tom Allen in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gordon Ramsay heads to Harpers Ferry in West Virginia, where he tries to save the Town's Inn, a historic hotel run by retired teacher and junk hoarder Karan Townsend. She has accumulated so many useless belongings that there is hardly any room to accommodate guests. Can Gordon convince her to get rid of her clutter or will the hotel continue to go down the pan?.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Jack, Dougal and Ted head off for a summer break at a caravan park. However, they immediately get on the wrong side of their fellow holiday-makers, and matters become even more dire when Father Noel Furlong turns up - with his hapless youth group in tow. Comedy, guest starring Graham Norton.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: The priests organise a raffle to raise funds to repair their leaky roof, planning to award a car as the prize. Unfortunately, Ted accidentally wrecks it before the grand draw takes place, and embarks on a frantic search for a replacement. Dermot Morgan and Ardal O'Hanlon play the Craggy Island clerics.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with Sean Lock and Henning Wehn taking on guest captain Bill Bailey and Jessica Hynes. Susie Dent is joined by Tom Allen in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Guests Rhod Gilbert, Sarah Millican, Gregg Wallace and Kate Silverton join host Jimmy Carr for an extended edition of the irreverent panel show in which teams captained by Jon Richardson and Sean Lock answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple with very different ideas of how they want to spend their retirement seek advice from Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman. While husband Tony plans on returning to the Wirral in Merseyside, his wife Karin hopes to move to southern Spain, where her sister has already settled.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Kevin and Natalie discover their beloved six-year-old German shepherd has a tumour. In desperation, they turn to Noel Fitzpatrick in the hope he can find a way to prolong Otto's life until their wedding day. The team also sees Jane, Simon and their Rottweiler puppy Elvis, who is having trouble walking, and seven-week-old Pomeranian Gucci, brought in with a broken paw by Amber and her two children after only 48 hours in her new home.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jon and Julia Shorrock host the first round of the B&B competition from their four-star Derwent House in West Sussex. The guests are split by gender to sample the area, with the men firing machine guns at a shooting range and the women relaxing at a spa - but a carpeted bathroom and shower without hot water raise questions.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Peter and Sharron Sorsky invite their fellow competitors to Kirkby Park B&B in Liverpool, but the presence of a security camera on the outside of the house leaves one guest feeling uneasy. Room inspections uncover all manner of unsightly problems, but a tour of nearby Knowsley Safari Park gives the contestants a chance to enjoy themselves.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Andy and Julian Banner-Price host the competition at their expensive B&B in Snowdonia, giving their new guests the priciest rooms. Peter and Sharron Sorsky are still reeling from their feedback forms and immediately find fault with the accommodation, and the group is taken to wash bedding the old-fashioned way at the local slate museum.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Annette McAnespie welcomes the group to Hazelwood Farm in Crayke, North Yorkshire, for the final B&B visit. The initial impressions are favourable and Peter and Jon begin to bond for the first time during a mosaic class, but not everyone feels up to the planned activity of a cycling tour.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time at Annette McAnespie's farm in Crayke, North Yorkshire, to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances, before the week's winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman help a couple who spend every summer apart due to work commitments search for properties in Brighton and Cadiz. A Spanish property would allow Cheryl and Andy to spend their winters together in a warmer climate, but one of the house-hunters proves to be especially selective about their potential purchase.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman comes to the aid of Colin and Tina, who are torn between a £200,000 property in Yorkshire and a life abroad. Tina is reluctant to move too far away from her family, but Colin is convinced their future lies in the Alentejo region of Portugal.(n)

programme.title: Time Team Specials
programme.sub-title: Boudica's Lost Tribe: A Time Team Special.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson traces the story of the warrior queen, following an excavation in Norfolk that may hold clues to what happened to her tribe, the Iceni, after its defeat at the hands of the Romans. The presenter visits Caistor St Edmund to investigate whether the Empire crushed Boudica's people or if she unwittingly led them to destruction.(n)

programme.title: Time Team Specials
programme.sub-title: The Somme's Secret Weapon: A Time Team Special.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson joins a dig near Mametz on the site of the Somme battlefield, where British trenches from 1916 are uncovered. The experts investigate the deployment of a weapon known as the Livens Flame Projector as the army launched its assault in northern France.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Cavachon Stampy has been hit by a car and is in a critical condition, leaving owners Jim and his wife Karen facing a difficult dilemma - to take the chance and put their pet through painful surgery, or let him die. Golden retriever Dylan has a limp, and owner Stuart has driven seven hours from Preston to seek Noel Fitzpatrick's help. Meanwhile, Ginny from Chelsea arrives with her beloved dachshund Lilly-Belle, who has lost the use of her back legs.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to Warwickshire to try to spruce up a 1970 Lotus Elan. The car is owned by an ex-racing driver but a painful spinal injury has prevented him from carrying out maintenance on the vehicle.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets estate manager Ed Waghorn and his wife Rowena, a couple living an almost self-sufficient life with their four children on a smallholding in Herefordshire. They have been constructing a timber-framed house using recycled materials, wood from nearby forests and stone from around the site, but as construction becomes a way of life for Ed, they seem to have lost sight of their goal.(n)

programme.title: Secret History
programme.desc: An insight into the pioneering work of criminal lawyer-turned-archaeologist Dr Kathleen Martinez, who has made it her life's mission to locate the final resting place of Cleopatra, Egypt's last queen. Despite centuries of searching, very little evidence of the location of Cleopatra's tomb has ever been uncovered, but Kathleen's radical new theory on the queen's identity has led her to search where no-one else dared. Her hunch stunned the archaeological establishment as she uncovered a hidden network of tunnels and a vast city of the dead, as well as a 35-metre deep underground hole that bears all the hallmarks of a burial shaft.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The staff at St George's A&E in south-west London tend to 59-year-old Debbie, who cut her hand on her lawnmower while distracted by thoughts of her son's forthcoming wedding. Also visiting the emergency room is 70-year-old George, whose eye has been impaled by a piece of driftwood, after he fell while bailing rainwater from his boat moored on the Thames. Plus, eight-year-old Phoebe arrives after accidentally sitting on a pair of scissors she left on a chair - getting them stuck in her thigh.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Police and paramedics in Cheshire respond to more incidents, including a 20-year-old who has returned home after a night out, collapsed in front of her parents and stopped breathing. Plus, a man calls the emergency services to say that a naked stranger his mother met at a punk gig has fallen down their stairs.(n)

programme.desc: Rare footage of the elusive animals that live in the unforgiving environment of the world's mountain ranges. programme.title: Wild Cities
programme.desc: Wildlife living in Cork, including grey herons searching for food in the English market, pied wagtails that make nests among the city's Christmas lights and terrapins that are a legacy of the popularity of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles in the 1980s.(n)

programme.title: Redwater
programme.desc: Eileen is quick to put a positive spin on the house fire, suggesting the family can claim enough on the insurance to get the cookery business off the ground. Bernie still suspects that Lance's death was not a heart attack - but who would want to kill him? The christening brings up painful memories of Mouse for Eileen, although the atmosphere is soured by a heated exchange between Dermott and Peter. Alfie becomes increasingly aware of his own mortality and asks for Dermott's help. Shane Richie, Susan Ateh, Angeline Ball and Oisin Stack star.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes needs someone to look after Grandad so she can treat herself to a much-needed holiday - but with private nursing homes being so expensive, it seems her only option is to convince the health visitor he has lost his marbles. Rory and Dino move in for a couple of weeks, and the matriarch is soon spitting feathers when the latter begins taking over the house, and her late husband gets in touch from beyond the grave with some ominous news. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.desc: The recently knighted Kenneth Branagh returns to his Bafta-winning role of the Swedish detective in three new adaptations of stories by Henning Mankell. Wallander moves into a new home with his girlfriend, only for their dreams of domestic bliss to be shattered when they discover a skeleton in the garden. He must find the killer if he has any hopes of getting his life settled again - and is surprised to discover the body was buried more recently than he first thought. Saskia Reeves and Sarah Smart co-star.(n)

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: Gates is desperate to sever his ties with Jackie after being duped into covering up her crime, but he is plunged into an even more dangerous situation as Arnott and Fleming close in on his secret and is forced to choose between his marriage and his career. Meanwhile, Harry meets Wade's sister Miriam and agrees to help find her brother's killer. Forensic crime drama, starring William Gaminara, Emilia Fox and Tom Ward, with Juliet Aubrey, Gillian Kearney and Jaye Griffiths.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster explores the Galapagos, a collection of volcanic islands in the Pacific known for its extraordinary wildlife. More than 150 years after Charles Darwin formulated his ground-breaking theory of evolution on the remote archipelago, Attenborough explains how life on the islands has continued to evolve in biological isolation, examining how the ever-changing volcanic landscape has given birth to species and sub-species that exist nowhere else in the world. He begins by revealing how Galapagos rose from the ocean four million years ago.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster reveals how life has learnt to adapt quickly in the ever-changing volcanic landscape, resulting in species that exist nowhere else in the world. David investigates the driving forces behind their evolution, exploring the appearance and behaviour of remarkable creatures and vegetation including giant whale sharks, marine iguanas and seemingly normal dandelion seeds that grow into plants the size of trees.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster concludes his exploration of the archipelago with a look at how, despite their proximity, no two of the 19 islands are the same. He also uncovers evidence that evolution on Galapagos is occurring faster than Charles Darwin could ever have imagined, and encounters Lonesome George, the last remaining giant Pinta Island tortoise, which died just a few weeks after filming in June 2012.(n)

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: A newlywed couple are in for a rude awakening when they jet off on their dream honeymoon. They are looking forward to an enjoyable tour of Europe - but a series of chaotic events, plus the intervention of the bride's old flame, leaves them at each other's throats and their marriage in tatters. Romantic comedy, with Brittany Murphy, Ashton Kutcher, Christian Kane and David Moscow.(n)

programme.title: The Cable Guy
programme.desc: A man makes the mistake of engaging a cable TV installer in conversation in a ploy to get all the channels for free. However, the manic repairman shows an invincible determination to be his new best friend - and does not take kindly to rejection. Comedy directed by Ben Stiller, starring Jim Carrey, Matthew Broderick and George Segal.(n)

programme.title: Magic Mike XXL
programme.desc: A male stripper who retired from the stage three years ago is persuaded to put on one last show. A troupe of dancers are also planning to call it a day and recruit him to headline their final show. The guys head off on a road trip to the venue, making some new friends and picking up a few new moves along the way. Drama sequel, starring Channing Tatum and Joe Manganiello.(n)

programme.title: Knocked Up
programme.desc: Ambitious journalist Alison's one-night stand with directionless layabout Ben has unexpected consequences when she discovers she is pregnant. However, the unlikely parents decide to give the relationship a try for their baby's sake, forcing Ben to face the challenge of accepting responsibility for the first time in his life. Romantic comedy, starring Seth Rogen, Katherine Heigl and Paul Rudd.(n)

programme.title: Trainwreck
programme.desc: A journalist lives her life by her father's maxim that monogamy never works, and has spent her adult life enjoying freedom from commitment. When she is sent to interview a doctor, an attraction develops between them, and she begins to wonder if there mighty be something to be said for a stable relationship. Comedy, starring Amy Schumer, Bill Hader, Brie Larson and Tilda Swinton.(n)

programme.title: Whiskey Tango Foxtrot
programme.desc: A journalist leaves behind her sheltered life in New York to report from the front line in Afghanistan. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Tina Fey and Margot Robbie.(n)

programme.title: Notting Hill
programme.desc: A recently divorced bookshop owner finds love with a glamorous Hollywood film star, but ends up the focus of unwanted media interest - which makes maintaining a relationship a tricky proposition. Romantic comedy written by Richard Curtis, starring Hugh Grant, Julia Roberts, Rhys Ifans, Emma Chambers, James Dreyfus and Gina McKee.(n)

programme.title: Knocked Up
programme.desc: Ambitious journalist Alison's one-night stand with directionless layabout Ben has unexpected consequences when she discovers she is pregnant. However, the unlikely parents decide to give the relationship a try for their baby's sake, forcing Ben to face the challenge of accepting responsibility for the first time in his life. Romantic comedy, starring Seth Rogen, Katherine Heigl and Paul Rudd.(n)

programme.title: Trainwreck
programme.desc: A journalist lives her life by her father's maxim that monogamy never works, and has spent her adult life enjoying freedom from commitment. When she is sent to interview a doctor, an attraction develops between them, and she begins to wonder if there mighty be something to be said for a stable relationship. Comedy, starring Amy Schumer, Bill Hader, Brie Larson and Tilda Swinton.(n)

programme.title: Whiskey Tango Foxtrot
programme.desc: A journalist leaves behind her sheltered life in New York to report from the front line in Afghanistan. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Tina Fey and Margot Robbie.(n)

programme.title: Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
programme.desc: A singer is transformed from naive country boy to the greatest rock 'n' roll legend of all time - with the traditional stand-bys of sex, drugs, failed marriages, falls from grace, spectacular comebacks and the love of a good woman along the way. Comedy spoof of music biopics, starring John C Reilly, Jenna Fischer and Raymond J Barry, and featuring appearances from Jack Black and Jack White.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Police Academy 6: City Under Siege
programme.desc: The clueless cops return yet again, this time to thwart the machinations of a crime lord behind a wave of raids and robberies in the city. Unfortunately, they are unaware Mr Big is always one step ahead thanks to a police informer. Penultimate entry in the comedy series, starring Bubba Smith, David Graf, Michael Winslow, Matt McCoy and Leslie Easterbrook.(n)

programme.title: King Arthur: Legend of the Sword - Behind the Scenes
programme.desc: Alex Zane visits the set of Guy Ritchie and Jude Law's epic action adventure to see what it takes to bring King Arthur to life.(n)

programme.title: Nine Months
programme.desc: A child psychologist's well-ordered world begins to fall apart when his live-in girlfriend announces she is pregnant. Not fond of children anyway, he dreads the impact a baby will make on his life - and to make matters worse, their eccentric Russian obstetrician admits he has never delivered a baby before. Romantic comedy, starring Hugh Grant, Julianne Moore, Jeff Goldblum, Joan Cusack and Tom Arnold, with Robin Williams in a cameo role.(n)

programme.title: The House Bunny
programme.desc: A Playboy bunny is ejected from Hugh Hefner's mansion for being considered over-the-hill on her 27th birthday, and has to find a new home and a fresh role in life. She becomes the unlikely house mother for a dowdy college sorority, and sets about giving its inmates a pin-up style makeover and turning their social lives around. Comedy, starring Anna Faris, Colin Hanks, Emma Stone and Kat Dennings.(n)

programme.title: Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
programme.desc: A Nascar racing champion has everything he could want - until an arrogant French rival seizes the title from him, and his wife runs off with his best friend. Forced to move back in with his mother, the downhearted driver turns to his estranged father for help rebuilding his shattered self-confidence. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell, John C Reilly and Sacha Baron Cohen.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: When a series of supernatural disturbances occur in New York city, a quartet of investigators and their dim assistant investigate. Reboot of the 1980s comedy franchise, starring Kristen Wiig, Melissa McCarthy, Kate McKinnon, Leslie Jones and Chris Hemsworth.(n)

programme.title: King Arthur: Legend of the Sword - Behind the Scenes
programme.desc: Alex Zane visits the set of Guy Ritchie and Jude Law's epic action adventure to see what it takes to bring King Arthur to life.(n)

programme.title: Airheads
programme.desc: Frustrated heavy metal band the Lone Rangers are determined to get air time for their new record and take a radio station hostage to ensure it happens. Comedy, starring Steve Buscemi, Brendan Fraser, Adam Sandler and Michael McKean.(n)

programme.title: Definitely, Maybe
programme.desc: A New York advertising executive on the eve of his divorce tells his daughter about his love life before he was married, including how he met her mother. However, he changes the names of his former lovers, leaving the girl - and viewers - to guess which one of three women he ended up marrying. Romantic comedy, starring Ryan Reynolds, Abigail Breslin, Elizabeth Banks, Rachel Weisz and Isla Fisher.(n)

programme.title: Grandma
programme.desc: A woman recovering from a break-up receives an unexpected visit from her granddaughter, who desperately needs to raise $600 before the end of the day. They visit a series of old contacts in search of a loan, which leads to long-buried secrets coming to light. Comedy drama, starring Lily Tomlin and Julia Garner.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: When a series of supernatural disturbances occur in New York city, a quartet of investigators and their dim assistant investigate. Reboot of the 1980s comedy franchise, starring Kristen Wiig, Melissa McCarthy, Kate McKinnon, Leslie Jones and Chris Hemsworth.(n)

programme.title: Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story
programme.desc: The struggling owner of a run-down gym is forced to take drastic action to prevent an arrogant fitness guru buying the business out from under him - and enlists his customers to form a dodgeball team in the hope of triumphing in the US championships. Sporting comedy, starring Ben Stiller, Vince Vaughn and Christine Taylor.(n)

programme.title: The Bad Education Movie
programme.desc: Incompetent teacher Alfie Wickers decides his students deserve a treat for somehow passing their GCSEs, so decides to take them on the greatest school trip of their lives - to Cornwall. However, a series of disasters leaves the class into trouble with suspicious locals. Comedy, starring Jack Whitehall, Harry Enfield and Iain Glen.(n)

programme.title: Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch
programme.desc: The odd couple return for this animated sequel, in which the lovable, loopy alien gives his adopted family more problems thanks to a major malfunction. With the voices of Dakota Fanning, Tia Carrere and Holliston Coleman.(n)

programme.title: A Bug's Life
programme.desc: Well-meaning ant Flik lands his colony in trouble when he accidentally disposes of an offering meant for a swarm of greedy grasshoppers - who promptly promise a horrible revenge. Faced with the imminent destruction of the anthill, he sets out to save the situation by enlisting the help of a few would-be heroes - an out-of-work troupe of bugs from a low-rent flea circus. Pixar animation, with the voices of Dave Foley, Kevin Spacey and Julia Louis-Dreyfus.(n)

programme.title: Finding Dory
programme.desc: Nemo and dad Marlin set out on an underwater adventure to help their forgetful friend Dory find her parents. Animated sequel, with the voices of Ellen DeGeneres, Albert Brooks and Ed O'Neill.(n)

programme.title: The Incredibles
programme.desc: A superhero couple facing litigation from a disgruntled public have to swap fighting crime for dreary suburban normality. Bored and frustrated, the husband signs up for a mysterious assignment on a remote island - unaware he is jumping straight into a trap that will require his wife and children to wield all their powers to save him. Pixar's animated adventure, with the voices of Craig T Nelson, Holly Hunter, Jason Lee and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Pocahontas
programme.desc: A Native American princess falls in love with an English settler, but her father is distrustful of the Europeans - not without just cause, as a cruel governor is prepared to wage war to get his hands on the gold he believes they are hiding. Disney animated drama, with the voices of Irene Bedard, Mel Gibson and Christian Bale.(n)

programme.title: The Little Mermaid
programme.desc: Underwater princess Ariel becomes bored with her aquatic existence and spends her time spying on humans, much to the annoyance of her father. Longing to live on land, she strikes a deal with a banished sea witch in order to become human and meet a prince - but there is a price to be paid. Disney's animated adventure, with the voices of Jodi Benson, Christopher Daniel Barnes and Rene Auberjonois.(n)

programme.title: A Bug's Life
programme.desc: Well-meaning ant Flik lands his colony in trouble when he accidentally disposes of an offering meant for a swarm of greedy grasshoppers - who promptly promise a horrible revenge. Faced with the imminent destruction of the anthill, he sets out to save the situation by enlisting the help of a few would-be heroes - an out-of-work troupe of bugs from a low-rent flea circus. Pixar animation, with the voices of Dave Foley, Kevin Spacey and Julia Louis-Dreyfus.(n)

programme.title: Finding Dory
programme.desc: Nemo and dad Marlin set out on an underwater adventure to help their forgetful friend Dory find her parents. Animated sequel, with the voices of Ellen DeGeneres, Albert Brooks and Ed O'Neill.(n)

programme.title: The Incredibles
programme.desc: A superhero couple facing litigation from a disgruntled public have to swap fighting crime for dreary suburban normality. Bored and frustrated, the husband signs up for a mysterious assignment on a remote island - unaware he is jumping straight into a trap that will require his wife and children to wield all their powers to save him. Pixar's animated adventure, with the voices of Craig T Nelson, Holly Hunter, Jason Lee and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: The Love Bug
programme.desc: Herbie, an irrepressible Beetle car with a mind of its own, takes a shine to a struggling racing driver and leads him to victory on the track. However, his success attracts the attention of an unscrupulous rival competitor, who will go to any lengths to win the most important race of all. Disney comedy, starring Dean Jones, Michele Lee, Buddy Hackett and David Tomlinson.(n)

programme.title: Operation Dumbo Drop
programme.desc: Five Green Berets stationed in Vietnam grudgingly undertake a bizarre mission - to help their native hosts by transporting a fully-grown elephant through 200 miles of rough jungle terrain. They soon hit upon a novel way of delivering the beast, deciding to load it into a plane, and then parachute it to its destination. Comedy, starring Danny Glover, Ray Liotta, Denis Leary and Doug E Doug.(n)

programme.title: The Shaggy DA
programme.desc: A boy who once turned into a dog grows up to become a principled lawyer, who runs for district attorney. However, as he campaigns against the crooked current DA, he finds himself once again undergoing a canine transformation and must find out the cause while keeping his condition a secret. Sequel to Disney comedy The Shaggy Dog, starring Dean Jones and Suzanne Pleshette.(n)

programme.title: Benji the Hunted
programme.desc: Talented mongrel Benji is separated from his trainer in a shipwreck and ends up stranded in the Canadian wilderness - where he becomes foster father to a litter of orphaned cougar cubs. However, a hungry timber wolf is also prowling in the area, and looks set to clash with the courageous dog. Disney adventure, starring Red Steagall, Frank Inn and Nancy Francis.(n)

programme.title: Aladdin and the King of Thieves
programme.desc: The Arabian adventurer prepares to marry his beloved Jasmine, but gets distracted by a gang of robbers who have stolen a powerful magical artefact, as well as the news that his long-lost father is still alive. Animated adventure sequel, with the voice of Robin Williams, Scott Weinger, Linda Larkin and John Rhys-Davies.(n)

programme.title: Oliver & Company
programme.desc: An orphaned kitten abandoned on the streets of New York is given shelter by a gang of canine thieves and their penniless owner, who is struggling to pay his debts to a brutal thug. Later, the kitten meets a kindly little girl and he thinks he has finally found a new home - but ends up leading her into danger. Animated adventure inspired by Oliver Twist, with the voices of Joey Lawrence, Billy Joel and Bette Midler.(n)

programme.title: Lilo & Stitch
programme.desc: A manic, mischievous alien escapes from the galactic police and crash-lands his spaceship on Hawaii. A lonely little girl mistakes the stranded creature for a dog and adopts him - but alien and Earth authorities are soon combing the island in search of him. Disney animated sci-fi comedy, with the voices of Daveigh Chase, Chris Sanders, Tia Carrere, Ving Rhames and David Ogden Stiers.(n)

programme.title: The Little Mermaid
programme.desc: Underwater princess Ariel becomes bored with her aquatic existence and spends her time spying on humans, much to the annoyance of her father. Longing to live on land, she strikes a deal with a banished sea witch in order to become human and meet a prince - but there is a price to be paid. Disney's animated adventure, with the voices of Jodi Benson, Christopher Daniel Barnes and Rene Auberjonois.(n)

programme.title: Monsters, Inc
programme.desc: Two monsters work for an energy firm that employs scary creatures to sneak into children's bedrooms and convert their screams into power. However, when a little girl accidentally wanders into the pair's domain, they have to race against time to return her safely home before anyone finds out. Pixar animated comedy, with the voices of John Goodman, Billy Crystal, Steve Buscemi and James Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Inside 11-year-old Riley's head lives a team of five that controls her emotions. Led by the eternally upbeat Joy, they have always ensured she lived a happy life - but when Riley's parents move to a new city, she is plunged into depression and the emotions face a crisis that threatens their entire world. Pixar animated fantasy, with the voices of Amy Poehler and Phyllis Smith.(n)

programme.title: Bambi
programme.desc: A young deer grows up in the forest, forming close friendships with other woodland creatures. When tragedy strikes, he is suddenly forced to fend for himself but ultimately becomes brave and resourceful enough to save his friends during a forest fire. Animated drama, with the voices of Bobby Stewart, Hardie Albright and Donnie Dunagan.(n)

programme.title: Peter Pan
programme.desc: Three children are visited in the night by a magical flying boy and a fairy named Tinker Bell. The strange youngster takes them away to his home, the magical island of Neverland, where his band of runaway youngsters are engaged in an ongoing battle with a crew of pirates. Disney animated adventure based on JM Barrie's novel, with the voices of Bobby Driscoll and Hans Conried.(n)

programme.title: Ratatouille
programme.desc: A rat finds his love of fine food has made him an outcast to his less discerning family. Separated from his fellow rodents by a storm, he winds up in a famous French restaurant, where he helps an incompetent kitchen assistant become the greatest chef in Paris. Pixar animated comedy from the director of The Incredibles, with the voices of Patton Oswalt, Ian Holm, Lou Romano and Peter O'Toole.(n)

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Inside 11-year-old Riley's head lives a team of five that controls her emotions. Led by the eternally upbeat Joy, they have always ensured she lived a happy life - but when Riley's parents move to a new city, she is plunged into depression and the emotions face a crisis that threatens their entire world.
